channel.display-name: The Fresh Prince OF Bel Air

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman revisits the Cliffs from Leeds, three years following their relocation to Adelaide. After facing tough times in the UK, they reveal whether emigrating was the answer to their problems and if it brought them the new life they were hoping for

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a semi-detached house in south London, a corner-terrace in Blackpool and a three-bedroomed property in Northumberland. They then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: The High Court enforcement officers try to get the compensation owed to a former office manager who won a tribunal after being sacked by text message. They also take on a company that has failed to pay an out-of-court settlement after selling a man a faulty boat, and receive a frosty reception at a garage that has not given a customer the money owed for selling a car on his behalf

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright meets the fraud investigators working on the case of a woman who illegally claimed Â£47,000 in benefits after claiming she was a single mother, and hears the story of a man who woke up one day to find he had lost his sight

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Henry Meadows and Jeremy Lamond help two teams search for valuable antiques at the Bath and West Showground near Shepton Mallet, Somerset. While there, they uncover a large pair of cattle horns and Dalton cauldrons that they hope will make a healthy profit at auction in Bristol. Tim Wonnacott also takes time out to visit designer William Morris's former country residence in the Cotswolds

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Kevin helps a man who has been wrongly accused of being a paedophile by a gang on his estate, and Daniel tries to convince Mrs Tembe to be Joe's godmother. Meanwhile, Al and Howard put an end to their conflict over Fliss. Medical drama, starring Simon Rivers

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win Â£1,000, but only by achieving absolute perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money rolls over to create a bigger jackpot in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps a young family with a budget of Â£350,000 search for a home in rural North Yorkshire. The presenter also learns about the `Mouseman' - a legend in the world of hand-crafted furniture

programme.title: James Martin
programme.desc: The chef makes a beef and red wine pie, a chicken fricassee and home-made marshmallows in a chocolate winter sauce, all designed to provide warmth on a cold winter's night. Plus, he meets farmers producing high quality salt marsh beef and one of only three pure chocolate producers in the UK

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion visit the Malvern Flea and Collectors Fair, and go head to head by purchasing items and then selling them at auction, aiming to make money for a chosen charity

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: BBC London News
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Matt Baker and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is shocked by an unexpected visitor berating her for what she has done - although she is not the only resident of the Square surprised by the new arrival. Jane notices Ian is placing a lot of pressure on Bobby, leading to an argument between the former couple that is only made worse when Jane discovers the real reason her ex-husband invited her to stay. Linda feels inspired to help the market traders in their fight against the council and rallies the troops for a demonstration, while Masood realises Shabnam hasn't got over the separation

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zosia is excited when Sacha finally gives her the chance to prove herself with a challenging patient, only for events to take a catastrophic turn. Jonny is shocked when Jac suggests her position gives her the right to make decisions about their daughter. He resolves to expose her as a bully - but it proves harder than he imagined. Harry is frustrated by the return of adoring patient Annie and does his best to shake her off

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: A birdwatcher is stabbed to death with his own knife, a case that holds a certain fascination for Humphrey, who was a keen twitcher in his youth. The victim was one of a group of enthusiasts who had visited the island for a glimpse of a famous parrot - but the team soon faces a conundrum as all the suspects were in full sight of one another when the crime was committed. As the cops search for answers, they uncover evidence of long-standing rivalries, secret jealousies and romantic entanglements. But would any of it justify killing a harmless ornithologist?

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: New series. The work of Yorkshire's Regional Roads Crime Team, who are using headcams as a new tool to collect evidence. A drugs dealer is faced with a police search on camera and a first-time offender speeds away from the cops in his wife's car, so the officers take off in pursuit. A drunk-driver is rudely woken by the police in a hotel car park, leading to an unexpected find

programme.title: The Mexican (2001)
programme.desc: A petty crook finds himself in a tricky situation when he tries to smuggle an antique gun from Mexico into America for his Mob boss. As events begin to spiral out of control, his girlfriend's displeasure and a pursuing hitman only add to the would-be bootlegger's woes. Comedy thriller directed by Gore Verbinski, with Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, James Gandolfini, Gene Hackman and JK Simmons

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman revisits Jim and Michelle McCallum, who previously participated in the show to sample life in Australia. The couple thought a move down under could offer them the relaxed lifestyle they craved, but faced the difficult prospect of leaving behind Jim's first daughter

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts examine properties up for auction, including a 100-year-old barn in Devon and three-bedroom homes in London and Lincolnshire. They follow the sales and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings, returning to review their progress after three months

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: Officers Marc and Tony go off-road, hoping to locate and recover a 4x4, and Lawrence and Kev try to recoup the unpaid fees owed to a marketing consultant just starting out on her freelance career

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates a couple who funded their lavish lifestyle in Spain with Â£97,000 of taxpayers' money. Plus, the unemployed woman aiming to break free of her dependency on benefits, despite suffering from low self-esteem after years of struggling to bring up her children alone

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Quay Antiques Centre in Topsham, Devon, where Philip Serrell and Charles Hanson offer advice to the two teams. Plus, Tim Wonnacott visits the historic Antony House in Cornwall

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Kevin races against time to save Steve from the vigilante gang who kidnapped him. Elsewhere, it's the day of Karen's interview at the hairdressing salon, and she is overjoyed at the prospect of a fresh start, while Valerie is similarly excited about the possibility of a permanent job becoming available at the Mill

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving perfection. If they fail in their attempt, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson heads to north Wales to help a recently retired couple find a rural retreat on a budget of Â£400,000. While in the region, the presenter also catches up with a pair who longed to lead a self-sufficient lifestyle and found their ideal home three years earlier

programme.title: James Martin
programme.desc: The chef creates his own version of toad in the hole with onion gravy, and demonstrates how simple it is to make a blackberry and apple millefeuille using home-made puff pastry. James also meets a dedicated family of fish farmers who have been producing top-quality trout for more than 30 years, and historian Ivan Day reveals a sweet but surprising midweek staple enjoyed by the Tudors

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion visit the Porte de Vanves flea market in Paris with Â£750 worth of euros to spend, but the foreign currency, along with the language barrier, could prevent them buying the best antiques on offer at rock-bottom prices

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which pairs of contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for the chance to compete for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: BBC News

programme.title: BBC London News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Matt Baker and Gabby Logan host the live magazine show, with a team of roving reporters presenting stories of interest from around the UK, plus big-name studio guests

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: Chris Edwards is concerned about the amount of money the company is losing to shoplifters, so he employs undercover detectives to cut down on the bargain-store pilferers. To add to his problems, a big discount retail chain is trying to poach his staff, and the opening of a new outlet in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, runs into trouble when head of human resources Frances Dove makes a surprising discovery - there's a rival just around the corner trading under the Poundworld name

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Headmistress Christine is away, leaving George in charge of the school. But he soon finds himself out of his depth when the immigration officers arrive for Lula, prompting the staff and pupils to launch a rooftop protest. Barry takes Gabriella to a fancy restaurant to discuss their future, while Dynasty gets a shock when she visits Kevin in hospital. Angus Deayton, Carl Au and Abby Mavers star

programme.title: Outnumbered
programme.desc: Ben is keen to show off his wilderness survival skills when he and his dad go off on a camping trip. Jake has a big decision to make about his education, while Pete's Australian goddaughter Stacey has outstayed her welcome, and Sue can't wait to see the back of her. Hugh Dennis, Claire Skinner, Daniel Roche and Tyger Drew-Honey star

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes goes on a diet after her family's comments about her weight, but soon realises how difficult it will be to lay off the fish and chips. Cathy's new partner seems more interested in her mother when he visits the Brown household, and Rory has a professional dilemma after he discovers illegal drugs at work

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Ex-England cricketer Steve Harmison, 2010 Commonwealth Games heptathlon gold medallist Louise Hazel, former world champion boxer Darren Barker and Leicester City footballer Kevin Phillips join team captains Phil Tufnell and Matt Dawson for another round of the quiz. Presented by Sue Barker

programme.title: Film 2014
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman and Danny Leigh review the latest big-screen releases, including Lars von Trier's Nymphomaniac Volumes I and II, in which Charlotte Gainsbourg heads an ensemble cast as a woman recounting her erotic experiences. They also cast their eyes over Jim Jarmusch's vampire romance Only Lovers Left Alive, starring Tilda Swinton and Tom Hiddleston, and Colin Farrell and Jessica Brown Findlay in fantasy drama A New York Winter's Tale

programme.title: Blandings
programme.desc: Period comedy based on the stories by PG Wodehouse, starring Timothy Spall as the befuddled Lord Emsworth - known to his friends as Clarence - and Jennifer Saunders as his indomitable sister Connie. The obnoxious Duke of Dunstable has come to stay, causing all manner of mayhem - but that turns out to be the least of Clarence's problems when he discovers his house guest has a dastardly plan to get him out of the way. Harry Enfield and Mathew Baynton guest star, with Tim Vine joining the cast as loyal butler Beach

programme.title: Wanted Down Under Revisited
programme.desc: One year on, Nicki Chapman catches up with accountant Simon Turner who believed his family could enjoy a better life in Perth, Australia. However, he had difficulty persuading his wife Trudy and daughter Kirsty to leave their home behind to spend a week Down Under

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Developers Lucy Alexander and Martin Roberts explore a one-bedroom flat in Wimbledon, south-west London, a house in Co Durham and a four-storey property in Kent, and then follow the sales at auction and talk to the buyers about their plans for the buildings. After three months the team returns to review their progress

programme.title: The Sheriffs Are Coming
programme.desc: High Court enforcement officers try to help an elderly woman reclaim the thousands of pounds she paid for a new driveway after she was left with a pile of bricks. They also act on the behalf of a man who carried out work for a leafleting company, but was never paid the Â£3,500 in wages he was due, and get more than they bargained for when they meet a north London car dealer

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates the case of Maxine Green, who was discovered to have fraudulently claimed Â£168,000 worth of benefits. Plus, he meets Chris Lewis who discusses how he searched for support after his business venture failed

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Jonathan Pratt and David Harper help two teams search for hidden treasures at Staffordshire County Showground, where one pair is urged against buying a vintage urinal. Tim Wonnacott also travels to Bath to explore No 1 Royal Crescent

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win a rolling jackpot that starts at Â£1,000, but only by achieving absolute perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money is carried over to create a bigger cash prize in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Presenter Nicki Chapman helps a couple search for their dream country property in Somerset on a budget of Â£420,000. Meanwhile, away from the hunt, she visits the historic Haynes International Motor Museum

programme.title: James Martin
programme.desc: The chef sets out to prove that home-made meals can be prepared in as little time as convenience food, and rustles up a simple chicken escalope with lemon, nuts and thyme, and a chocolate cake that doesn't need to be cooked for dessert. Plus, his neighbour and ex-Formula One driver Jody Scheckter drops by with a sample of his buffalo mozzarella from his award-winning farm, and food historian Ivan Day makes a quince ice-cream in three minutes

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Antiques experts Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion hunt for items of interest at an enormous car-boot sale in Essex. They aim to purchase bargains and sell them on, in a bid to make the most profit for their chosen charities

programme.title: Pointless

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is unable to give up on Stacey so Alfie takes her to visit Luke, who has some worrying information about her cousin. As police and news crews turn up for the market traders' protest, Denise, Peter and Lucy are frustrated that Ian is failing to show his support - but he is more worried about what Jane will do following their argument. Aleks gets Tamwar to do his dirty work, while Masood provides moral support to Shabnam by escorting her to a job interview

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A murder at a Turkish baths seems like an open-and-shut case, as witnesses put an ex-serviceman at the scene of the crime and the suspect has left his ID in a locker. But as Gently and Bacchus begin their search for the man, things soon become complicated. His psychiatrist reveals he was showing signs of schizophrenia, while his brother claims he was far too soft to have killed a man - and when a second body turns up, the duo are led into a world of medical secrets at an Army testing facility. Crime drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby, with William Ash and Jemma Redgrave

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the political debate from Swindon, Wiltshire, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include author Jeanette Winterson and writer and philosopher Roger Scruton

programme.title: The Color of Money (1986)
programme.desc: Fast Eddie Felson takes cocky pool player Vincent under his wing and sets about moulding him into the kind of hustler he used to be. As Vincent gradually immerses himself in the seedier aspects of the game, Eddie begins to discover something of himself in his protege - and he does not like what he sees. Martin Scorsese's drama sequel to The Hustler, starring an Oscar-winning Paul Newman, with Tom Cruise, Mary Elizabeth Mastrantonio and John Turturro

programme.title: Saints and Scroungers
programme.desc: Matt Allwright investigates the case of an individual who assumed multiple identities to fraudently gain almost Â£100,000 in benefit claims from Croydon Council, and meets a couple attempting to balance work with caring for their two autistic sons who are in need of constant help and support

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The red and blue teams head to Norfolk to look for items to sell at auction and perhaps unearth a few unexpected treasures. On hand to lend their expertise are Caroline Hawley and Thomas Plant

programme.title: Perfection
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the general knowledge quiz in which contestants can win Â£1,000, but only by achieving absolute perfection. If they fail in their bid, the money rolls over to create a bigger jackpot in the following game

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a young professional couple who are looking to move away from the hustle and bustle of London and upsize to a country home in Hampshire. While in the area, the presenter visits the Hawk Conservancy Trust and helps release a rehabilitated bird of prey back into the wild

programme.title: James Martin
programme.desc: The chef turns his attention to TV dinners, preparing squid with a dipping sauce, as well as tapas of chicken wings and wedges with his own tomato topping. James heads to Co Durham to meet Catherine and Richard Furze, who have turned their love of American popcorn into a thriving business. Historian Ivan Day also recreates finger food from the frost fairs of yesteryear - mutton pies and baked pippins

programme.title: Put Your Money Where Your Mouth Is
programme.desc: Jonty Hearnden and Christina Trevanion face the antiques showdown, making purchases at four locations before selling at least half of them on at auction. In their battle for premium profits and the coveted title of champion, there are plenty of ups and downs before the overall winner is determined. Last in the series

At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Chris Evans and Fearne Cotton present the final show of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Comedian Josh Widdicombe, choirboy-turned-presenter Aled Jones and DJ Sara Cox join Frank Skinner for the comedy panel show, competing to have their pet hates banished to the infamous room. Their gripes include Lord of the Rings, fish bones and death metal

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Wales v France (Kick-off 8.00pm). John Inverdale introduces coverage from the Millennium Stadium, where the third round of fixtures gets under way. Wales are looking to get back on track after being comprehensively outplayed by Ireland in their last match, while France have won at home to England and Italy so far. This is a clash with an intriguing sub-plot. Many of French rugby's woes have been blamed on the influx of foreign players into the cash-rich Top 14 league, of which Wales have provided several, while Welsh rugby's major problem is how to keep hold of their players to strengthen the domestic regions. Les Bleus suffered the ignominy of ending last season at the bottom of the table, which was the start of a dismal 2013 that saw them win just two matches all year, and heaped considerable pressure on coach Philippe Saint-Andre, although they traditionally prosper in years following British & Irish Lions' tours and another win here would move them closer to the Grand Slam. With commentary by Eddie Butler, Jonathan Davies and Martyn Williams, and analysis by Shane Williams, Thomas Castaignede and Jeremy Guscott

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Regional News and Weather
programme.desc: Regional News

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Graham is joined by British actor Dominic Cooper, currently playing James Bond creator Ian Fleming on Sky Atlantic, and Lily Allen, who performs her latest single Air Balloon. He also subjects more audience members to the dreaded red chair - so their stories had better be good

programme.title: Pound Shop Wars
programme.desc: Chris Edwards is concerned about the amount of money the company is losing to shoplifters, so he employs undercover detectives to cut down on the bargain-store pilferers. To add to his problems, a big discount retail chain is trying to poach his staff, and the opening of a new outlet in Londonderry, Northern Ireland, runs into trouble when head of human resources Frances Dove makes a surprising discovery - there's a rival just around the corner trading under the Poundworld name

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Omnibus. Kat tries a different approach in her efforts to speak to Stacey, while Alfie grows increasingly suspicious of his partner's secretive behaviour. Jane returns for another visit and soon picks up on the tension between Ian and Denise, forcing the latter to confess her sins to her fiance's ex, and Aunt Babe holds the fort while the Carters go out, although Linda is devastated to learn some bad news about her beloved dog Lady Di. The stallholders plan to gatecrash a secret council meeting - much to the horror of Aleks - and Masood doesn't respond too well when Shabnam suggests he needs to smarten himself up

programme.title: Weatherview
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: James Martin is joined by chefs Peter Weeden and Michael Caines, and presents highlights from Rick Stein, Celebrity MasterChef and Exploring China with Ken Hom and Ching-He Huang. Plus, wine expert Jane Parkinson chooses the drinks to match the dishes in the studio

programme.title: Food & Drink
programme.desc: Chef Gennaro Contaldo joins Michel Roux Jr in the kitchen to create an authentic lasagne with focaccia from scratch, while Kate Goodman offers a guide to choosing the right Italian red wine to make the perfect match. Great British Menu judge and restaurateur Oliver Peyton joins them for a debate on whether people should care more about where their food comes from

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Dan Walker and guests look ahead to the weekend's action, including today's early kick-off between Chelsea and Everton in the Premier League. Plus, a review of the opening matches in the last 16 of the Champions League

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: Italy v Scotland (Kick-off 1.30pm). Gabby Logan presents the first of today's matches from the third round of the championship, which takes place at the Stadio Olimpico in Rome. This fixture in recent years has traditionally been the one to decide which nation finished bottom of the table, but both teams produced an improvement last season when they finished fourth and third respectively in the standings, as Ireland and France faltered. However, both began this year's championship with two defeats, and Scotland have failed to score a try so far, and will be aware that they have lost on their last three visits to the Italian capital. With commentary by Andrew Cotter and Andy Nicol, and analysis by Ian McGeechan, Chris Paterson and Carlo Del Fava

programme.title: Live Six Nations Rugby Union
programme.desc: England v Ireland (Kick-off 4.00pm). John Inverdale introduces the concluding fixture in the third round of the tournament, as the sides lock horns at Twickenham. England have won the last three meetings between the nations, including two in Dublin, and while that may be remarkable in itself, the fact that Ireland have failed to score a single try in any of those fixtures will certainly be one of concern to the visitors. This match will have a major bearing on the championship, with Ireland aiming to clinch the Triple Crown following impressive wins against Scotland and Wales, and England looking to impress in their first match of the year on home soil. With commentary by Eddie Butler, Brian Moore and Phillip Matthews, and analysis by Clive Woodward, Keith Wood and Jeremy Guscott

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: General News/Current Affairs

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman invite teams made up of TV chefs, cooks and bakers to come up with the least likely answers to questions posed to the public. The contestants are Rustie Lee, Antony Worrall Thompson, Theo Randall, Rachel Allen, Jean-Christophe Novelli, Paul Rankin, Aaron Craze and John Whaite

programme.title: The Voice UK
programme.desc: The final round of blind auditions and it's bound to be a tense time for all as the coaches fill the last few places on their teams. Kylie Minogue, Will.i.am, Tom Jones and Ricky Wilson will only want the best singers to take through to next week's battle rounds, when their acts will be pitted against each other in head-to-head knockout performances. Emma Willis and Marvin Humes are backstage with the hopefuls and their families

programme.title: The National Lottery
programme.desc: Nick Knowles hosts the game show in which two pairs of strangers team up, each battling to outdo the other by listing as much as they know about a given subject. The first couple to win two rounds get the chance to play for Â£100,000 and each time the champions defeat a new set of opponents their winnings mount up. Includes the Lotto and Thunderball draws, presented by Gaby Roslin. Last in the series

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Fletch argues with his estranged wife when she doesn't want him to have the children for the weekend, so eldest daughter Evie sneaks out of the house - but makes the mistake of finding refuge in an abandoned building with a weak ceiling. Robyn has to discover why a teenage girl is lying, while a woman is brought in after tripping over a paving stone and wonders if she has a good case against the council. Alex Walkinshaw and Amanda Henderson star

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: News

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League clashes, including Chelsea v Everton at Stamford Bridge and Arsenal v Sunderland at the Emirates Stadium. The Blues and Gunners were looking for another three points as the title race intensified, while the Toffees needed a win to boost their chances of reaching the top four, and the Black Cats aimed to move away from the relegation zone. Plus, action from Cardiff City v Hull City, Manchester City v Stoke City, West Bromwich Albion v Fulham, West Ham United v Southampton and Crystal Palace v Manchester United

programme.title: The Football League Show
programme.desc: Manish Bhasin presents highlights and all the goals from today's fixtures in the Championship, League One and League Two, including Charlton Athletic v Queens Park Rangers at the Valley, as the visitors looked to maintain their promotion challenge. Plus, action from Middlesbrough v Leeds United at the Riverside Stadium

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage of day 11 of the Games in Russia, featuring live ice hockey and highlights from the speed skating and bobsleigh. The first action comes immediately from the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, joining the second men's ice hockey qualification play-off 30 minutes after face-off, as the sides look to book a place in the quarter-finals. The top four-ranked teams from the group stage qualified for the last eight, with the nations ranked 5-12 having to play an extra fixture. Highlights of the men's 10,000m speed skating final at the Adler Arena in Sochi can be seen at 3.00, with action from the first run of the women's two-man bobsleigh to follow from 3.45 at the Sliding Centre Sanki in Krasnaya Polyana

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces the concluding coverage on day 11 in Russia, featuring live freestyle skiing, and action from the bobsleigh, curling and ice hockey. The opening focus is on a selection of sports across the Games, with the women's two-man bobsleigh taking place at the Sliding Centre Sanki in Krasnaya Polyana, the men's half-pipe freestyle skiing qualifiers at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park and any required play-off matches at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi. At 5.30 attention focuses fully on Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana as the medals are decided in the men's half-pipe freestyle skiing, with the first champion being crowned as the discipline makes its debut in the Games. The final action of the day comes from Sochi's Bolshoy Ice Dome and Shayba Arena, where the men's ice hockey qualification play-offs reach a conclusion. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day 11 in Russia, where five gold medals were decided in venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Alpine skiing, freestyle skiing, short track speed skating, Nordic Combined skiing and speed skating were the sports that saw new champions crowned, while the bobsleigh, curling and ice hockey also continued. The alpine skiing is always a highlight of any Games, and today's focus at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana was on the women's giant slalom. Viktoria Rebensburg claimed gold four years ago in Vancouver, as Germany excelled in the women's disciplines, with Slovenia's Tina Maze having to settle for a second silver of the Games, and Elizabeth Goergl of Austria taking bronze. Plus, a look ahead to tomorrow, which will see a further eight golds awarded

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: New series. The contest to find Britain's best amateur sewer returns, this time with 10 competitors trying to impress judges May Martin from the Women's Institute and Savile Row designer Patrick Grant. In the first set of challenges, they must make a simple tunic out of cotton, transform a plain high-street woollen skirt in just 90 minutes, and fit a model with a made-to-measure silk nightgown. Presented by Claudia Winkleman

programme.title: How China Fooled the World - With Robert Peston
programme.desc: China has the second largest economy in the world and has been growing at an astonishing rate for the past 30 years. In a documentary for the This World strand, the BBC's new economics editor Robert Peston reveals that the vast majority of the enormous investments in industry and infrastructure has been built on credit, leaving huge debts and questions over how much of the money can ever be paid back. Featuring interviews with ex-US treasury secretary Henry `Hank' Paulson, former Financial Services Authority chairman Jonathan Adair Turner and banking analyst Charlene Chu

programme.title: House of Fools
programme.desc: A magazine offers a chimpanzee as a prize to anyone who can provide a genuine photo of a ghost, and Vic instantly begins a search of the flat with Beef and Bosh. He decides to perform a seance and successfully summons a spirit, but Bob is the only one who can see it. Guest starring Reece Shearsmith. Last in the series

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Horizon
programme.desc: As they contain no active ingredient, placebo medicines and pills should not really work, but they are now being shown to be effective in helping treat pain and depression and even alleviating some of the symptoms of Parkinson's disease. This programme explores why they work and how everyone could benefit from them

programme.title: The Super League Show
programme.desc: Tanya Arnold introduces action from the latest Super League matches, which included Warrington Wolves v St Helens at the Halliwell Jones Stadium, Salford Red Devils v Wakefield Trinity Wildcats at the AJ Bell Stadium and Widnes Vikings v London Broncos at the Stobart Stadium Halton

programme.title: Britain's Great War
programme.desc: Jeremy Paxman presents this four-part documentary charting how the First World War affected the lives of the British people and created what is known as modern Britain. The first film focuses on the early stages of the conflict, the announcement of which led to stunned disbelief, followed by a mass recruitment drive as volunteers signed up to fight. With the fear of invasion gripping the country, even Boy Scouts were engaged to help guard bridges, and for the first time British civilians were bombed from the air and fired on by enemy ships. Jeremy hears from a 105-year-old eyewitness to one such attack - the shelling of Hartlepool in December 1914

programme.title: Operation Grand Canyon with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Part two of two. The historian and his team continue down the Colorado River in antique wooden boats as they re-create the pioneering 280-mile expedition through the Grand Canyon that was led by explorer John Wesley Powell in 1869. Along the way they carry out the same surveying tasks as the original party with period equipment, including taking photographs with a 19th-century 3D camera

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools - The Modern Monarchy
programme.desc: A team of young reporters investigates the role of today's British royal family, focusing on the Queen's coronation and the monarchy's relationship with Parliament and the military

programme.title: Schools - D-Day
programme.desc: A compilation of three short film in which historian Dan Snow tells the story of the Normandy landings of June 6, 1944, arguably the day Nazi Germany was brought to its knees by Allied forces. Dan reveals how the historic invasion was planned for two years via espionage and photographic analysis, and highlights the heroism, sacrifices and determination of the soldiers on the front lines of the landmark military operation

programme.title: Schools - Roman Voices
programme.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes explores why Britain became part of the Roman Empire in 43AD and visits the Roman fort at Vindolanda, Northumberland, the sacred baths at Aquae Sulis, Somerset, and the Corinium Museum in the Cotswolds to discover what it was like for the soldiers, women and children who lived during this time

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage of day 12 of the Games in Russia, featuring live alpine skiing, ice hockey, snowboarding, curling and cross-country skiing. The Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana is the first port of call at 7.00 for the opening run in the men's alpine skiing giant slalom, with the second and concluding run at 10.50. The first men's ice hockey quarter-final gets under way at 8.00 at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, and there are the concluding stages of the men's and women's snowboarding parallel giant slalom disciplines from 9.00 at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana. The women's curling semi-finals begin at 10.00 at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, and there is continued coverage at 12.00, along with the cross-country men's and women's team sprint finals at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex in Krasnaya Polyana

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces further coverage of day 12 of the Games in Russia, featuring live ice hockey and curling, and updates from the speed skating and biathlon. The ice hockey is first up at 1.00, joining the second men's quarter-final at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi 30 minutes after face-off, with the nations looking to emulate the achievements of Canada four years ago. Another sport into the knockout stage is curling, and the men's semi-finals take place at the Ice Cube Curling Centre from 3.00, with the winners guaranteed at least a silver medal, and the losers meeting in a bronze-medal play-off. There are also updates on the women's 5,000m speed skating final and biathlon mixed relay, with medals set to be decided in both events

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents the concluding coverage on day 12 of the Games in Russia, featuring live bobsleigh, curling and figure skating. The bobsleigh is first at the Sliding Centre Sanki in Krasnaya Polyana, with the third run in the women's two-man discipline at 4.15, followed by the concluding fourth run at 5.30. Canadian competitors claimed gold and silver four years ago on home soil, with Kaillie Humphries and Heather Moyse edging out Helen Upperton and Shelley-Ann Brown by less than one second to be crowned champions. There is a chance to catch up on events at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi at 5.00, where the men's semi-finals are set to reach a conclusion, before the final event of the day at 6.15. The ladies' singles is the last figure skating discipline of the Games to take place, and today sees the short programme at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi, with the skaters looking to put themselves in a strong position ahead of tomorrow's free programme. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights from day 12 in Russia, where eight gold medals were decided at venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Cross-country skiing and snowboarding both saw two events come to a conclusion and, as ever, much of the attention was on the Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana, where both runs of the men's alpine skiing giant slalom took place. Carlo Janka of Switzerland was fastest on the first run four years ago in Vancouver, and held on to clinch gold despite Norway's Kjetil Jansrud's impressive second run, which was enough to give him the silver medal ahead of compatriot Aksel Lund Svindal. As well as the drama of eight new champions being crowned, there was also activity in the figure skating and the latter stages of the men's ice hockey and curling

programme.title: The Restaurant Man
programme.desc: Tony in Gravesend thinks launching a pizzeria is going to be one big happy family business, but his children have different feelings about helping their headstrong dad build his dream. Russell Norman locks horns with Tony as he tries to make him change his idiosyncratic ways, which include never writing his plans down on paper, changing his mind like the weather and not taking advice from someone who can actually cook - his wife

programme.title: Line of Duty
programme.desc: Following the tragedy at the hospital, Fleming continues to work under cover in missing persons and looks into the disappearance of 15-year-old Carly Kirk, a case in which Denton appears to have a personal interest. The under-suspicion detective also starts to scrutinise the background of the AC-12 officers and gathers compromising evidence to use against the anti-corruption team

programme.title: Inside No 9
programme.desc: Primary school teacher Tom tries to repay a good turn from a late-night caller, but he gradually becomes the victim of his own generosity. As time passes, his new friend Migg becomes an increasingly dominant part of Tom's life, threatening his relationship with aspiring actress girlfriend Gerri. Steve Pemberton and Reece Shearsmith star, with Gemma Arterton (Quantum of Solace) and Conleth Hill (Game of Thrones)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Dolphins - Spy in the Pod
programme.desc: David Tennant narrates the second in a two-part documentary providing a close-up view of one of the planet's most captivating and intelligent creatures. A young bottlenose strikes out on its own and soon makes friends with a rare humpback dolphin, joins a gang and takes part in a bizarre initiation ceremony. Other highlights include superpods feeding among sharks, and orcas using their wiles to catch seals. All the footage is captured by several spy creatures - one of which meets a sticky end when it falls victim to a hungry predator

programme.title: Children's Emergency Rescue
programme.desc: A baby with a hole in her heart desperately needs surgery, but the nearest hospital is closed and nurse Jamie must keep his patient alive long enough to reach another unit 100 miles away. Documentary following a team of doctors and nurses caring for some of the UK's sickest children. Narrated by Fiona Bruce

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: The story of a father and son, a vicar and surgeon respectively, who were accused of being grave robbers

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: The story of Catherine Hayes, who enlisted the help of two men to murder her husband in the 18th century, and was subsequently burnt at the stake

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: The story of Emmeline Pankhurst, who was put on trial in 1912 for damaging property as part of her fight for women's suffrage

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: The trial of Jonathan Wild, who controlled most of London's criminal underworld by the early 1720s and was charged with stealing lace from a blind woman's shop

programme.title: Schools - In My Shoes Plus
programme.desc: A look at life in modern China, from the metropolis of Shanghai to the provinces of Yunnan and Guangxi

programme.title: Schools - In My Shoes Plus
programme.desc: Through the eyes of three local children, the programme looks at life in Germany, and features the country's mountains, rivers and coastline

programme.title: Nature's Weirdest Events
programme.desc: Chris Packham investigates more unusual natural events, with reports on fish `walking' out of the water in Florida and bees in France that are making multicoloured honey. He also looks into a phenomenon in which trees ooze a blood-red liquid, and explores instances of people all over the world claiming to have heard alien-like sounds from the sky

programme.title: Italy Unpacked
programme.desc: The second leg of Andrew Graham-Dixon and Giorgio Locatelli's journey down the west coast of Italy finds them in Lazio, the region containing Rome. Instead of heading to the capital, the duo explore the legacy of those who took refuge away from the cauldron of life in the nation's foremost city and its politics of power and pontiffs. Giorgio visits Viterbo to find out more about the first papal conclave that he remembers from school, before treating Andrew to a meal fit for a pope with recipes from a historic cookbook

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: The programme pursues the theme of nature in art as it joins a group of children learning about wildlife. Writer David M Sindall discusses his book After Alyson, which follows the fate of a partially deaf man who searches for a rural idyll. Plus, a look at the work of photographer Emma Amsden. With voiceover

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the opening events on day 13 of the Games in Russia, featuring curling, freestyle skiing, Nordic Combined skiing and ice hockey. The initial action comes from the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi at 8.30, where the women's bronze-medal match takes place, before heading to the Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana at 9.30 for the men's freestyle skiing skicross discipline. There is little let-up for the competitors, with the last 16, quarter-finals, semi-finals and final all occurring in the space of just over an hour. There is a return to the curling to see the conclusion of this morning's match from 10.50, along with the climax of the men's Nordic Combined skiing cross-country 4x5km event at the RusSki Gorki Jumping Centre in Krasnaya Polyana. The programme concludes with the women's ice hockey bronze-medal match at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi from 12.00, as the two nations that lost in the semi-finals meet in an attempt to salvage something from their Games

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents this afternoon's coverage from the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, where the final of the women's curling gets under way at 1.30. After nine round-robin matches and a semi-final, the teams will be used to the conditions at the rink, as they aim to emulate the achievements of Sweden four years ago in Vancouver. The Swedes finished second in the standings behind the Canadians, but edged a thrilling encounter when the two met in the final, to win the tournament for the second successive occasion. Women's curling has only taken place in four Winter Olympics, and came to prominence in Britain in 2002, when Rhona Martin skippered the Great Britain team to glory. However, four years ago was a disappointment as too many defeats saw the British fail to qualify for the semi-finals, but skipper Eve Muirhead will be confident this time around, having won the world championships last year

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces the concluding coverage of the 13th day of the Games in Russia, which focuses on the ladies' figure skating free programme at the Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi. This event brings the figure skating to a close at these Games, with the leading competitors from yesterday's short discipline looking to clinch a medal. Yuna Kim of South Korea won gold in spectacular fashion four years ago, setting a new world record in both the short and free routines, to finish ahead of Japan's Mao Asada and Joannie Rochette of Canada. That gold was the first ever won by a Korean in the figure skating at a Winter Olympics, with the USA having by far the best record of any nation in Olympic history, although the medals four years ago were evenly shared between seven different nations. Plus, updates from the final of the women's ice hockey at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi and the women's freestyle skiing half-pipe event at Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding looks back at events on day 13 of the Games, staged at venues across Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana in Russia. Gold medals were awarded in curling, figure skating, freestyle skiing, Nordic Combined skiing and ice hockey, with the figure skating and Nordic Combined coming to a conclusion at these Games. Today saw the first finals in the Games' two ongoing team sports - the curling and ice hockey - and in both cases it was the women who were involved. The ice hockey at the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi saw the nations aiming to emulate the achievements of Canada, who won gold four years ago on home soil to continue their dominance of the Games, having been victorious on three of the four occasions since women's ice hockey was given official Olympic recognition. Three of the finals have been between Canada and the USA, with Sweden and Finland being the only other nations to have won medals in the women's event

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers' Asian Adventure
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King continue their culinary journey around Asia by heading to Thailand, where they discover why Bangkok has a reputation as the street food capital of the world, and help serve up school dinners. Heading out into the country's central plains, the duo join paddy-field workers and find out how rice is grown

programme.title: Bible Hunters
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part documentary about the dedicated men and women searching for the world's oldest biblical writings and manuscripts in Egypt. Their discoveries included strange zodiacs, hymns to Egypt's solar god and heretical Christian texts that threatened to shake the foundations of Christianity

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz with a difference, joined by guests Jack Dee, David Mitchell, Bill Bailey and regular panellist Alan Davies. He asks questions with an international theme, and awards points for the most interesting answers

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Laura Kuenssberg

programme.title: The Restaurant Man
programme.desc: Restaurateur Russell Norman gives people the benefit of his experience during the crucial few months before and after they open their establishments for business. In the first edition, he helps Rich and Matt with their concept for an edgy burger bar in Southampton, which is plagued by problems with the food, the service and the layout of the restaurant

programme.title: See Hear
programme.desc: The programme pursues the theme of nature in art as it joins a group of children learning about wildlife. Writer David M Sindall discusses his book After Alyson, which follows the fate of a partially deaf man who searches for a rural idyll. Plus, a look at the work of photographer Emma Amsden. With voiceover

programme.title: Britain Underwater
programme.desc: As Britain is battered by extreme weather yet again, reporter Richard Bilton investigates the causes of the flooding that has devastated so much of the country. He meets families whose lives have been ruined and asks whether more could be done to protect towns and villages

programme.title: The Tea Trail with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: In the first of two This World documentaries examining the stories behind the nation's favourite beverages, adventurer and broadcaster Simon Reeve looks at the production of tea. He begins in the Kenyan coastal city of Mombasa, where most of the leaves for teabags are bought at auction, before travelling through eastern Africa to meet some of the millions of people who pick, pack and transport it. He drinks tea with everyone from Maasai cattle herders to the descendants of the original plantation owners, and hears claims of low wages and child labour

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: Ousman Manneh, who plays for Handsworth United in Birmingham, explores the lives of teenage African footballers, many of whom fall prey to unscrupulous trainers and agents. Ousman, who also coaches youngsters in the sport, travels to Ghana to discover the ways boys are exploited and meets those who are helping the victims

programme.title: Schools
programme.desc: Current and former sports stars, including Jonny Wilkinson and Gary Lineker, share their passion for learning another language

programme.title: Schools - Lilly the Magnificent
programme.desc: German schoolgirl Lilly yearns to succeed as a magician, but everything goes wrong during rehearsals

programme.title: Loona Balloona
programme.desc: A German tale of loss, love and life as a boy comes to terms with the death of his father, alongside his grieving mother

programme.title: The Little Promise
programme.desc: In this drama from Hong Kong, Jack feels embarrassed about his father being deaf until a promise teaches him how to stand up for what is right

programme.title: Schools - My Kite Is Flying
programme.desc: A boy receives help from his grandfather to improve his maths skills. Drama from Hong Kong

programme.title: Wonders of Nature
programme.desc: Short films celebrating wildlife and the natural world, continuing with a look at frogs

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Great Interior Design Challenge
programme.desc: Architectural historian Tom Dyckhoff presents a competition searching for untapped interior design talent in Britain, with experts Sophie Robinson and Daniel Hopwood acting as judges. In each heat, three hopefuls take on similar rooms in neighbouring homes and have 48 hours, Â£1,000 and the help of a builder to interpret and realise the homeowners' wishes. The first edition sees the contestants take on large bedrooms in Edwardian homes in the north London suburb of Muswell Hill

programme.title: Torvill & Dean
programme.desc: On Valentine's Day in 1984, British ice-dancing pair Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean skated into the record books when their routine to music from Ravel's Bolero received the highest set of marks ever awarded, including nine perfect scores of 6 for artistic impression. This documentary tells the story of the performance, with contributions by Torvill and Dean

programme.title: Lifeline
programme.desc: Angela Rippon appeals for funds on behalf of Womankind Worldwide. To donate, please call 0800 011 011, go online at www.bbc.co.uk/lifeline or send donations to Womankind Worldwide, Freepost, BBC Lifeline Appeal

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine introduces coverage of the opening events on day 14 of the Games in Russia, featuring live curling and freestyle skiing. The Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi is the first port of call as the final day of curling begins with the men's bronze-medal match from 8.30. The two losing semi-finalists will be aiming to end their tournament on a high and clinch third place ahead of this afternoon's final, and it was Switzerland who were successful four years ago in Vancouver, beating Sweden 5-4 in a dramatic final end. Coverage switches at 9.30 to Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana for the climax of the freestyle skiing, with the women's skicross heading to a dramatic conclusion. The last 16, quarter-finals, semi-finals and final are all scheduled to take place in this session, with just over an hour of unrelenting action in store, before returning to the curling at 11.00

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards presents further coverage from Russia on day 14 of the Games, featuring live ice hockey, alpine skiing and curling. The first action comes from the Bolshoy Ice Dome in Sochi, where the opening semi-final in the men's ice hockey gets under way at 12.00, with the winning team guaranteed at least a silver medal. Attention switches at 12.45 to Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana, for the first run in the women's alpine skiing slalom discipline, with the second and concluding run scheduled for later this afternoon. The remaining live coverage of this session gets under way at 1.30 at the Ice Cube Curling Centre in Sochi, where the men's curling final takes place. This is the fifth final since the sport was reintroduced to the Games in 1998, and few would bet against Canada being involved, given that their record features two victories and two runners-up spots in that time. Plus, updates on the men's and women's team pursuit speed skating qualification and the women's 4x6km biathlon relay

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces the final coverage of day 14 of the Games in Russia, featuring live short track speed skating and updates on the alpine skiing. The Iceberg Skating Palace in Sochi is the venue for the concluding day of short track speed skating in these Games, with three finals scheduled to take place. The quarter-finals and semi-finals of the men's 500m and women's 1,000m are the first races on the ice, with the final of the former set for 5.43 and the latter at 5.53, with the men's 5,000m relay final providing the climax at 6.18. All of the short track medals four years ago were split between just five nations, with China winning most golds and South Korea the most medals. Away from the speed skating, there are regular updates from Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana, where the second and concluding run in the women's slalom is the featured event, as the competitors look to succeed Germany's Maria Riesch as champion. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights from the 14th day of the Games in Russia, where seven more gold medals were decided at venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. Curling, freestyle skiing and short track speed skating saw their involvement at these Games come to a conclusion, while the biathlon and alpine skiing were the other sports to crown new champions. The ice hockey also continued with the men's semi-finals, although much of the team sports focus would have been on developments at the Ice Cube Curling Centre, where the sixth staging of the Olympic men's curling tournament was set to climax, with high expectations of another Canadian victory, following their triumphs in Vancouver and Turin in the last two Games. Plus, a look ahead to the weekend's highlights, which will see the 22nd staging of the Winter Olympics brought to a close

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: John Humphrys invites four more contestants to take their place in the black chair, where they answer questions on American rock band the Grateful Dead, the novels of 19th-century author Wilkie Collins, the history of Bedlam and the English civil wars. They then have a chance to demonstrate their general knowledge in the final round

programme.title: An Island Parish
programme.desc: Rosie Guille organises a visit from a group of respected artists to capture the beauty of the island and highlight conservation issues. Methodist lay preacher Karen Le Mouton has dedicated the last three years of her life to the people of Sark, but she and her congregation must come to terms with the idea she may have to leave to begin ordination training. Last in the series

programme.title: Mock the Week Looks Back at Animals
programme.desc: Another selection of material from the show's archives, this time featuring quickfire gags and off-the-cuff silliness on the topic of animals. Host Dara O Briain oversees contributions by Frankie Boyle, Russell Howard, Micky Flanagan, David Mitchell, Adam Hills and Miles Jupp

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Host Stephen Fry begins the `K' series with a range of fiendish questions on the topic of knees and knockers. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Sara Pascoe, Jack Whitehall and David Mitchell, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones

programme.title: Alan Davies Apres-Ski
programme.desc: The comedian and a selection of guests from the worlds of comedy, entertainment and sport take an irreverent look at all the latest news and action from the Winter Olympics in Sochi as the Games draw to a close. Last in the series

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Weather

programme.title: Synecdoche, New York (2008)
programme.desc: A neurotic playwright suffering a series of worrying physical ailments takes on a grand project - building a replica of New York in a warehouse for a play based on his own life. After his wife goes travelling, he drifts into an affair, but then finds a second lover in the actress playing his mistress in the production. Comedy drama, starring the late Philip Seymour Hoffman, with Catherine Keener and Samantha Morton

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: David Dimbleby chairs the political debate from Swindon, Wiltshire, where the panellists answering questions from the audience include author Jeanette Winterson and writer and philosopher Roger Scruton

programme.title: Hidden Kingdoms
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the survival techniques used by the animal kingdom's smallest creatures. North America's Sonoran Desert is home to the grasshopper mouse, which is capable of disarming scorpions and centipedes twice its size, and displays a power and athleticism that enables it to avoid the attentions of rattlesnakes and tarantulas. In Africa, the elephant shrew, known as the sengi, employs speed to keep its distance from predators, following a meticulously constructed - and maintained - network of tiny racetracks in the savannah. The film concludes with Hidden Kingdoms Revealed, a 10-minute report on how the documentary was made. Narrated by Stephen Fry

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: The Little Polar Bear 2
programme.desc: Lars the polar bear cub goes on a journey around the world with his friends leading to the Galapagos Islands, where they try to save the local wildlife - including a prehistoric fish - from a volcanic eruption. Animated adventure sequel, with the voices of Wesley Singerman and Rudee Sade

programme.title: The Magic Box (1951)
programme.desc: Biopic of cinema pioneer William Friese-Greene, who gave up a successful career in photography to follow his dream of developing a camera that would capture moving images. However, his tireless experiments to perfect his creation would come at great personal cost. Starring Robert Donat, Maria Schell, Margaret Johnston, Richard Attenborough and Michael Redgrave

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents coverage on the 15th and penultimate day of the Games in Russia, featuring live snowboarding and cross-country skiing. Rosa Khutor Extreme Park in Krasnaya Polyana is the venue for the initial action from 9.15, as the snowboarding reaches a conclusion with the men's and women's parallel slalom disciplines. This is the first time the parallel slalom has been included in an Olympic Games and the competitors face an intense schedule, with the last-16, quarter-finals, semi-finals and finals all taking place this morning. From 11.00 the attention switches to the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex for the concluding moments of the women's 30km mass start freestyle event, where a strong Norwegian contingent is expected to challenge for medals in the quest to succeed Justyna Kowalczyk as champion

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson comes to the aid of a couple with Â£1.2 million to spend, who are searching for a property in rural Cheshire. He also visits Tatton Park Estate, home to the UK's only pineapple vinery, and discovers how it was run in its heyday

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: The experts look at how items connected to domestic servants can have as much appeal to collectors as their grander counterparts, and presenter Paul Martin explores the Victorian class system at Lanhydrock in Cornwall

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Jonathan Edwards introduces further coverage of the penultimate day of the Games in Russia, featuring live alpine skiing, speed skating and biathlon. The alpine skiing is first on the schedule at 12.45 at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana, where the first run in the men's slalom takes place. This is the final alpine skiing discipline at these Games, and one which is difficult to predict given the testing conditions on the slopes. The speed skating is covered from 2.15 at the Adler Arena in Sochi, featuring the finals of the men's and women's team pursuit events, with coverage split between biathlon and speed skating from 2.30. This is the final day of the biathlon at the Laura Biathlon & Ski Complex in Krasnaya Polyana, with the concluding discipline being the men's 4x7.5km relay

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents the latest coverage on the 15th and penultimate day of the Games in Russia, featuring the men's alpine skiing slalom at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana. This programme covers the second and concluding run, which provides a major challenge given that it is staged under floodlights on an unpredictable course. The recent warm weather in the resort has made for testing conditions and this represents the finale of the alpine skiing at these Games. Giuliano Razzoli of Italy won the gold medal four years ago in Canada, with the dramatic second run taking place in rain, providing enough problems to force the course to be shortened and the times in the concluding run to be considerably slower than in the first. Only Andre Myhrer of the leading contenders came close to beating his first run in his second attempt down the course, which moved him up from 10th place to secure a bronze medal

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, Football League and Scotland

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Further coverage on the 15th and penultimate day of the Games in Russia, featuring the conclusion of the men's alpine skiing slalom at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana. Presented by Clare Balding

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Mark Chapman presents a round-up of the classified results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, Football League and Scotland

programme.title: Live Winter Olympics
programme.desc: The live coverage from Russia continues at the Sliding Centre Sanki in Krasnaya Polyana, with Clare Balding introducing the second run in the men's four-man bobsleigh competition. There are also highlights of the opening run, with the competitors looking to stay in contention at this stage, ahead of tomorrow's climactic final two runs. The USA set the pace from the off four years ago in Canada, recording course record times in both of the first two runs, to give themselves enough of an advantage to clinch the gold medal, ahead of Germany in second and Canada in third. That victory confirmed the Americans as one of the major players in Olympic bobsleigh, as they, along with the Germans and Swiss, are the three nations who have dominated the four-man event. Subsequent programmes subject to change

programme.title: Winter Olympics
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights from the 15th and penultimate day of the Games in Russia, where seven more gold medals were decided at venues in Sochi and Krasnaya Polyana. This was the last full day of action given that tomorrow will feature just three sports and the closing ceremony, and new champions were crowned in alpine skiing, biathlon, cross-country skiing, snowboarding and speed skating today, while the bobsleigh and ice hockey also continued. The alpine skiing schedule reached a conclusion at Rosa Khutor Alpine Resort in Krasnaya Polyana, with both runs in the men's slalom, as the competitors aimed to succeed Giuliano Razzoli and win the gold medal. Plus, a look ahead to tomorrow's closing ceremony at the Fisht Olympic Stadium in Sochi, and a preview of the men's ice hockey final

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The three petrolheads demonstrate their love of small cars with a trip to Ukraine. Jeremy Clarkson chooses a Volkswagen Up for the journey, while Richard Hammond takes a Ford Fiesta and James May opts for a Dacia Sandero. On their adventure, the trio absorb the history of the Crimean Peninsula, including a visit to an old submarine pen - but the carefree exploration looks likely to become a chore when Jeremy, Richard and James are challenged to a long drive north through the expansive country, during which they must combat serious boredom. And as if that wasn't arduous enough, a new task is set when they arrive in Kiev - a trip into the wasteland of Chernobyl. This edition also features a track test of the Danish Zenvo ST1 supercar and James Blunt returns for another drive in the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: The Lost Portrait of Bonnie Prince Charlie
programme.desc: In 2009, art detective Dr Bendor Grosvenor proved the Scottish National Portrait Gallery's painting of Charles Edward Stuart was not in fact of the Instigator of the Jacobite uprising of 1745. In this programme, Grosvenor tries to track down a long-lost portrait of the Young Pretender by artist Allan Ramsay in the hope of unravelling one of the greatest mysteries in British art

programme.title: There Will Be Blood (2007)
programme.desc: An oil prospector presents the public image of a caring family man while nurturing a murderous ambition to seize control of land and wealth at any cost. But his insatiable greed leads to a violent conflict with a young priest who is also intent on using the people and resources of an oil-rich town for his own ends. Paul Thomas Anderson's historical drama, starring an Oscar-winning Daniel Day-Lewis, with Paul Dano and Dillon Freasier

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Manchester City v Barcelona (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the last-16 first leg at the Etihad Stadium, as the hosts welcome the Spanish champions for an eagerly awaited contest. This is the first time City have progressed past the group stage of the Champions League, and they would have hoped for an easier tie than this one. Much of their difficulty was due to them finishing second in their group behind Bayern Munich and therefore having to play a group winner, although they can take confidence from their outstanding home record and the suspicion that Barca are now slightly past their majestic peak. Presented by Adrian Chiles, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Andy Townsend, and analysis from Roy Keane, Lee Dixon and Roberto Martinez

programme.desc: Ageing spy James Bond comes out of retirement to tackle a mysterious mastermind who wants to take over the world. Meanwhile, another agent disguises himself as Bond to face the evil genius over the baccarat table. Spoof spy adventure, starring David Niven, Peter Sellers, Woody Allen, Orson Welles, Deborah Kerr and Ursula Andress

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: The Midsomer Worthy amateur choir is thrown into panic when baritone Connor Simpson is killed on the eve of the prestigious regional Four Choirs competition. A birdwatcher is also murdered shortly after, and DCI Barnaby and DC Jones uncover bitter rivalry and tense marital relationships as they try to establish if there is a connection between the two cases. Peter Capaldi guest stars

programme.title: The Cube
programme.desc: Boxer David Haye and I'm a Celebrity 2013 winner Kian Egan set out to complete a series of fiendishly difficult challenges, ranging from agility tests to skill trials, with the aim of winning a jackpot of Â£250,000 for charity. The more money they stand to win, the harder the task in front of them, but having both experienced the horrors of Bushtucker Trials, will they find it easier than most to hold their nerve? Phillip Schofield presents

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Saturday Night Takeaway
programme.desc: New series. The Geordie duo return with the entertainment show, featuring undercover pranks, sketches, famous guests and competitions. This Morning's Eamonn Holmes and Ruth Langsford take part in I'm a Celebrity Get Out of Me Ear, Little Ant and Dec mix with Hollywood A-listers at the Baftas and Michael Buble provides the voiceover and end-of-show performance. Plus, Ashley Roberts sends the presenters to the very edge in Ant v Dec, and an audience member plays to win the items advertised in one of last week's commercial breaks

programme.title: Take Me Out
programme.desc: The love lift delivers Mr Wales 2013 - personal trainer Michael from Carmarthen - along with cleaner Jason from Bristol, Glasgow landscape gardener David, who's also a semi-pro wrestler, and Vincent, a champagne importer from London. They're all hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval. But in the final round, if only one or two remain lit, they will have the choice of opting for the mystery girl, based solely on the sound of her voice. Paddy McGuinness presents. Last in the series

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host chats to Fresh Meat star and comedian Jack Whitehall, actor-presenter Bradley Walsh, and Lizzy Yarnold and Jenny Jones, who won gold and bronze in the skeleton and snowboarding events respectively at Sochi 2014. Plus, an interview with the boys from McFly and Busted - all except Charlie Simpson - who now make up the pop group McBusted. Tom, Danny, Harry, Dougie, Matt and James talk about their tour and also perform in the studio

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Manchester City v Barcelona (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the last-16 first leg at the Etihad Stadium, as the hosts welcome the Spanish champions for an eagerly awaited contest. This is the first time City have progressed past the group stage of the Champions League, and they would have hoped for an easier tie than this one. Much of their difficulty was due to them finishing second in their group behind Bayern Munich and therefore having to play a group winner, although they can take confidence from their outstanding home record and the suspicion that Barca are now slightly past their majestic peak. Presented by Adrian Chiles, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Andy Townsend, and analysis from Roy Keane, Lee Dixon and Roberto Martinez

With contributions by Frank Lampard and Harry Redknapp

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Steve, Tracy and Amy are admiring steam engines at the museum when they suddenly find Roy by their side, but he vanishes into the crowd and later turns up unannounced at the cafe. Todd tricks Marcus into going for a drink on the pretext he needs to talk about his real father, while Izzy tells Owen he can trust Anna, no matter what Phelan's game is. programme.title: Brit Awards 2014
programme.desc: James Corden hosts the star-studded music ceremony live from London's O2, featuring performances by Arctic Monkeys, Bastille, Rudimental, Bruno Mars, Disclosure, Ellie Goulding, Lorde, Katy Perry and Pharrell Williams. Bastille and Disclosure lead the way with four nominations each, while David Bowie is in the running for British Male Solo Artist and the coveted Album of the Year, 30 years after winning his first Brit. Jessie J, Jake Bugg, James Blake, Daft Punk, Haim, Drake, Laura Mvula, Tom Odell, London Grammar, Janelle Monae and One Direction are among those also hoping to take home a prized statuette, while viewers have the chance to vote for the winner of this year's new category, Best British Video

programme.title: Live UEFA Europa League Football
programme.desc: Swansea City v Napoli (Kick-off 8.05pm). Coverage of the last-32 first-leg encounter at the Liberty Stadium, where the Swans are aiming to cause an upset. Napoli can consider themselves unfortunate to be involved in this contest after finishing third in their Champions League group, only behind Borussia Dortmund and Arsenal due to a marginally inferior head-to-head record after all three secured 12 points. The Swans finished second in their Europa League group, with a record of two wins, two draws and two defeats, and will need to improve on their domestic form if they are to progress. Presented by Matt Smith, with commentary by Clive Tyldesley and Andy Townsend, and analysis from Lee Dixon and Gordon Strachan

They're all hoping to land a date with one of 30 single women on the Isle of Fernandos. However, to have any chance of succeeding, they must ensure the female participants keep their lights on as a sign of approval.
