programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs. programme.desc: Radio DJ Noel Cunningham hosts the second dinner party in Dublin, and hopes to bring a hint of sophistication to the contest by enforcing a set of rules for the occasion. However, he must first deal with the hangovers from the previous night's event, and tries to lift his guests' spirits by arranging traditional entertainment

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Former Miss Universe Ireland Rozanna Purcell hosts the third party in Dublin, but a kitchen mishap leaves the model rushing for bandages. However, she impresses her four male guests when she reveals her outfit for the evening - which leaves little to the imagination

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Journalist Paul Martin hosts the fourth dinner party from his apartment and tries to woo his guests with a Michael Jackson-themed night, complete with magicians and a dance-off. Unfortunately, Brian Kennedy and Noel Cunningham do not miss the opportunity to criticise him when they smell burning food

programme.title: Celebrity Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Actor George McMahon hosts the week's final dinner party, and tries to put the fun back into the contest with a Gangsters and Molls-themed evening. However, his culinary skills fail to impress his guests, and the feud between Brian Kennedy and Paul Martin continues before the winner of the 5,000 euro prize for charity is announced

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Nick Hewer and Rachel Riley present the words-and-numbers game, with Jonathan Edwards in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Deal or No Deal
programme.desc: Contestants try to beat the banker and guess the contents of mystery boxes to win a big-money prize. In a game-changing twist, players could now win up to Â£500,000 by doubling their winnings with box 23 - if they are brave enough to buy it with what they have already won. Presented by Noel Edmonds

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Teacher Kerrie Brinkley-Whittington hosts the final dinner party in Essex, and uses a few props to help her night go with a swing. However, she is soon under fire from entrepreneur Richard, who is not amused to be asked to contribute more to group conversations, and when trucker Tony makes an emergency run to the garden, it looks as if the rhubarb dessert could be just as controversial. At the end of the evening, the winner is announced

programme.title: Coach Trip
programme.desc: The coach pulls into Salou in Spain's Catalonia region, and after a messy morning gutting fish for lunch, the group cleans itself up ready for a pole-dancing class. Brendan Sheerin oversees proceedings at the vote, during which one couple are left disappointed

programme.title: Superstar Dogs
programme.desc: John Barrowman taps into the UK's affection for all-things canine as dogs and their owners compete in a number of challenges. Wendy and her springer spaniel Zebadee come up against Roz and her Nova Scotia duck tolling retriever Donald, and Mark and his Labrador-cum-border terrier, Santia. The overall winner of the competition will be crowned at this year's Crufts at Birmingham's NEC arena

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa makes a revealing documentary about life with her family for a school project. However, after it receives praise at the Sundance Film Festival, the Simpsons become national hate figures. Featuring the guest voices of Jim Jarmusch and John C Reilly

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: John Paul is faced with the dilemma of saving rapist Finn or letting him die. Meanwhile, Dennis's situation goes from bad to worse, but there could be an unexpected ray of light at the end of the tunnel. programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: Extreme Dog Styling
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the extraordinary and competitive world of extreme dog grooming. Across America, poodles are being crimped, primped and dyed to compete in a multimillion-dollar activity. Every year they come together at the world's largest grooming event in Hershey, Pennsylvania, and until now, the competition has been dominated by US participants. However, British dog-lover Su Eld-Weaver is hoping she and her pet Dobby can beat the Americans at their own game

programme.desc: A spontaneous gesture lands the Crane brothers a double date with two beautiful women, and Frasier tries to help Niles overcome the feeling that he is betraying Maris when they all take a trip to a cabin in the country. programme.desc: Elated at being named one of People magazine's `30 to Watch Under 30', Raj makes a pass at Penny and becomes very arrogant, making it hard for Leonard to maintain a positive perspective on his friend's new-found confidence. Guest starring Charlie Sheen

programme.title: Channel 4 News

programme.title: The Restoration Man
programme.desc: Building surveyor Alan Appleby and his wife Dora have saved a derelict flint mill in Stone, Staffordshire, from falling down and set about repairing all the damage. However, Alan's passion for old structures soon takes over and the couple end up ploughing all their time and money into the project. Architect George Clarke helps them every step of the way and uncovers the connection between the mill and the world-renowned pottery and ceramics of Josiah Wedgwood

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: Tony Robinson travels along the north Norfolk coast through one of the least developed spots in Britain, finding out how the area maintained its rural, remote identity despite the dynamic industrial changes of the Victorian age. From the arrival of Bertie, Prince of Wales at Sandringham House to the opening of Cromer Pier, Tony's four-day walk sees him learn about key periods in the county's history. He explores prime shooting estates, purpose-built seaside resorts, salt marshes and disused railway lines as he discovers how powerful landowners were able to control development and even shape the railways to suit their needs. Last in the series

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of the US Army's Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack

programme.title: Still Life
programme.desc: Premiere. A resident of a rural Quebec village is found dead in the woods, but locals dismiss the death as a hunting accident. However, a police inspector is not convinced and unearths dark secrets in the community in his efforts to uncover the truth. Whodunnit based on Louise Penny's novel, starring Nathaniel Parker and Mylene Dinh-Robic. Edited for violence

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours

Chris is nervous about his first day at work

programme.title: The Big British Immigration Row
programme.desc: Highlights from Monday's studio debate exploring the emotive and controversial topic of immigration, examining how it is affecting the United Kingdom and its citizens. Subjects covered include national identity and racial and cultural integration, with contributions by MPs, decision-makers, opinion-formers and immigrants themselves

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers
programme.desc: In south Wales, inspectors Keith Hogben and Gemma Cooper follow up a report of two dogs being kept in appalling conditions and discover seven puppies are also loose in the house and adding to the mess. On a hot summer's day in Birmingham, Scott Vanes deals with a canine that has been locked in a small conservatory, while Herchy Boal visits a family having trouble letting go of an old dog with health problems

programme.title: Police 5
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Kate McIntyre offer advice on crime prevention, using hidden-camera stunts to reveal the tricks of the thieves' trade, and also accompanying police on raids and talking to amateur detectives and have-a-go heroes who fought back in the name of justice. Plus, Shaw Taylor tries to reunite theft victims with what is rightfully theirs, and there are appeals for information on the nation's most wanted criminals

programme.title: Benidorm ER
programme.desc: The documentary returns after a mid-series break. Tests reveal a heart attack after a 48-year-old from Glasgow is rushed in with chest pains, while Dr Torres treats a West Midlands woman struggling for breath and thinks the situation is serious enough for her to be admitted to hospital. A severely visually impaired man from Aberdeen explains what it is like to receive medical attention for a suspected broken arm from people he cannot see and in a language he does not understand, while a Norwegian visitor arrives at the ER with a gash on her wrist caused by the shattering of a glass shower door

programme.title: Holiday Love Rats Exposed
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of Brits who have been conned out of tens of thousands of pounds and left broken-hearted by people preying on single holiday-makers looking for love. Jeannette was swept off her feet by Rudiger in Sorrento, Italy, and over the next nine months spent Â£20,000 on him, only to discover he was wanted in several countries for duping women. Jane met Nigerian Michael in a Gambian nightclub and during their brief marriage gave him so much money she ended up bankrupt - unaware he was already in a long-term relationship

programme.title: Law & Order

She tells the detectives it is the fourth time she has been assaulted by the same man over the past 15 years, but runs off before they get to ask any more questions. Crime drama, guest starring Jennifer Love Hewitt

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Ethan is conducting a post-mortem examination when he has to step out of the room for a minute and returns to find the body has gone. The supposedly dead man is found wandering the offices still very much alive and claiming he was shot by his room-mate - who is later found dead in the back of a bin wagon. Megan's investigation leads her to a shocking cover-up at local government level

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The murder of a cigar-maker leads to some surprising facts being uncovered about the victim. programme.desc: Lisa's epilepsy is so severe it could kill her and the frequency of her seizures means she is virtually housebound. Neurosurgeons at Liverpool's Walton Centre offer her the option of brain surgery that represents her last hope of leading a more normal life with her husband and young daughter. Simon has a tumour growing on his pituitary gland that is pressing on his optic nerves and needs an emergency operation to remove it and save his eyesight, but the procedure is highly intricate and could damage his vision

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: A look back at some of the past transformations from the series in which interior designer Ann Maurice visits houses and offers advice on making them attractive to would-be buyers

programme.desc: Historian Allan Chapman discusses Isaac Newton's revolutionary theories, which postulated that the universe is governed by a set of mathematical principles. programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Bianca suspends Ms Montgomery after her claim that Heath assaulted her is shown to be false when Tamara tells the police she saw him surfing at the time of the alleged attack. Matt's flirtatious behaviour with Evelyn lead to a fight with Oscar, while Kyle helps Tamara pursue her plan to organise an unofficial music festival

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Brad fears for Josh's swimming career following the abseiling accident and advises him to see a specialist sports surgeon. Meanwhile, Kyle learns Georgia has been discharged from hospital and decides to get his priorities in order by breaking up with Kate - who then has an awkward encounter with her ex, Mark Brennan

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The agents try to track down an arms dealer who has the launch codes for the Navy's encrypted satellite system and is offering them to the highest bidder. In an attempt to win the confidence of the buyer, Ducky poses as an ageing Englishman trying to sell the information. Guest starring Armand Assante, with David McCallum and Mark Harmon

programme.title: Kidnapped
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the abduction of a teenager from her home in Salt Lake City in 2002. The search for the girl turned into a nationwide media frenzy, but nine months later as hope was fading, she was found alive and well in the company of an unbalanced couple. Starring Amber Marshall, Dylan Baker and Lindsay Frost. Edited for violence and language

programme.desc: After a 12-year-old is hit by a van, the team examines both the boy's body and the vehicle for any further information about his condition. Elsewhere, a workman is badly burned in an electrical explosion and the medics must determine if he has suffered internal injuries before transferring him to the burns unit. An assault victim arrives at the Royal London Hospital with his life hanging in the balance, but the damage to his face makes it difficult to assess him, while a motorcyclist is brought in after a high-speed crash

programme.title: Ultimate Emergency Bikers
programme.desc: In North Yorkshire, police officer Lee Cobb deals with an incident in which a motorcyclist has come off his bike and been thrown 30 metres across a roundabout, while paramedic Keith Moran rushes to the rescue of a surfer in Cornwall. Biker cop Lucy Watson has a hunch about a car that she pulls over in Essex - and a broken rear light leads to a discovery that casts doubt over the driver's right to be in the UK. Last in the series

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While on medical leave, Ducky reopens a 12-year-old case by talking officials at a cemetery into releasing the body of a Navy commander whose post-mortem he carried out 12 years previously. Meanwhile, the team is called in to investigate the death of a sergeant from carbon monoxide poisoning - and finds a copy of Ducky's exhumation request on the man's laptop. Crime drama, starring David McCallum

programme.title: Suspects
programme.desc: Jack and Charlie investigate an assault on the owner of the Green Pit nightclub in east London and discover the victim's sister unconscious in the cellar, with blood pouring from a head wound. The detectives' efforts to piece together what happened are hampered by the lack of CCTV footage, and the case takes a confusing turn when a 19-year-old student is found dead with a flyer for the club in his pocket. Crime drama, starring Damien Molony and Clare-Hope Ashitey

programme.title: The Big British Immigration Row
programme.desc: A studio debate exploring the emotive and controversial topic of immigration, examining how it is affecting the United Kingdom and its citizens. Subjects covered include national identity and racial and cultural integration, with contributions by MPs, decision-makers, opinion-formers and immigrants themselves

programme.title: World's Toughest Prison
programme.desc: One-off documentary revealing the technological advances that have enabled North Branch Correctional Institute in Maryland, USA, to become one of the most secure prisons in the world, holding more than 1,400 of America's most dangerous convicts. Surprisingly, the building was made possible thanks to historic engineering breakthroughs at four earlier prisons - including the Tower of London and Alcatraz Island - each of which featured an innovation that allowed engineers to build even more secure facilities. Now, with its impenetrable cells able to withstand bomb blasts and technology ensuring dangerous inmates are kept safely away from each other, North Branch may be the toughest yet

programme.title: A Right Royal Scandal
programme.desc: Documentary looking at some of the incidents involving the royal family that have made media headlines around the world, including the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, in 1997 after her car crashed while being pursued by the paparazzi in Paris. The programme also reflects on the fuss that ensued after the publication of topless pictures of the Duchess of Cambridge sunbathing on holiday, as well as photos of Prince Harry playing strip billiards in Las Vegas. Narrated by Alistair Appleton

programme.title: Henry VIII & Anne
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historian Suzannah Lipscomb examines the extraordinary story of the tumultuous love affair between Henry VIII and Anne Boleyn, beginning by exploring the seven-year courtship of the royal couple. Using dramatic reconstructions and first-hand accounts, she delves into their backgrounds and personalities, searching for the triggers - personal and political - that would lead to their falling in love

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits Eden Lodge in the popular holiday and sailing resort of Falmouth in Cornwall, booking into the B&B as a guest to gain an impression of the average customer experience. She is not impressed by owners Lynn and Ziggy's self-decorated bedrooms and the condition of their indoor swimming pool, and decides they need a serious wake-up call if they are to operate at a profit

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: Michael Jenkinson operates on 34-year-old Steffan to remove a tumour and has to keep him conscious throughout the surgery to avoid damaging the part of his brain controlling his left arm and hand. Professor Paul Eldridge asks 45-year-old dress-maker Anita to make a choice over whether to go ahead with a risky procedure, while 19-year-old Bethany undergoes a programme of intensive neurological rehabilitation after suffering a brain haemorrhage that has caused lasting damage to her eyesight and voice

programme.title: My Face Is Eating Me Alive
programme.desc: The return of the programme documenting tales of remarkable human experiences from around the world, beginning with a Zimbabwean woman seeking treatment for her daughter's facial tumour. Tare's ordeal started eight years ago when she was 13 and had toothache. Her mother Thandiwe could not afford dental treatment and an aggressive swelling on the teenager's upper left jaw began to restrict her airways and push her jaw out of her mouth. Help eventually arrived from charities Saving Faces and Girl Child Network Worldwide and from a UK surgeon who volunteered to operate on Tare

Detective drama, starring Peter Falk, Tyne Daly, Greg Evigan and Don S Davis. Edited for language

programme.title: Columbo
programme.desc: The owner of an American football team is found dead in a swimming pool, and his drowning is regarded as an accident. The down-at-heel detective is convinced that foul play was involved and sets out to prove his case - but his chief suspect has a cast-iron alibi that places him miles away from the scene of the crime. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Culp

programme.desc: A sailor's body is discovered in a disused restaurant, and his death is initially ascribed to an accidental drug overdose. programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A nuclear power plant inspector suffers radiation poisoning, forcing the team to consider the possibility that a foreign power deliberately targeted him. Elsewhere, a woman with a family history of aneurysms is experiencing dizziness, but a series of diagnostic tests only deepens the mystery, and paramedics are called out to King's Cross station to deal with a cardiac arrest

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Fed up with unwanted advice, Ricky calls a family meeting to declare she will make her own decision about the baby. Chris is nervous about his first day at work

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Disaster strikes on the camping trip when Mason goads Josh into having a go at abseiling. Back on Ramsay Street, Callum finds his way back into Josie's good books when he buys her a puppy, while Sonya tells Jacob to leave Erinsborough - but still manages to hurt Toadie's feelings

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Marine major is found dead in an underground maintenance room, having scratched out one of his own eyes - and the presence of a webcam suggests someone watched him die. The team investigates with the help of the US Army's Lt Col Hollis Mann, and links the case to wanted terrorist Mamoun Sharif, an old adversary who is threatening to unleash a chemical attack

programme.title: Still Life
programme.desc: Premiere. A resident of a rural Quebec village is found dead in the woods, but locals dismiss the death as a hunting accident. However, a police inspector is not convinced and unearths dark secrets in the community in his efforts to uncover the truth. Whodunnit based on Louise Penny's novel, starring Nathaniel Parker and Mylene Dinh-Robic. Edited for violence

programme.title: The Dog Rescuers
programme.desc: In south Wales, inspectors Keith Hogben and Gemma Cooper follow up a report of two dogs being kept in appalling conditions and discover seven puppies are also loose in the house and adding to the mess. On a hot summer's day in Birmingham, Scott Vanes deals with a canine that has been locked in a small conservatory, while Herchy Boal visits a family having trouble letting go of an old dog with health problems

programme.title: Police 5
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Kate McIntyre offer advice on crime prevention, using hidden-camera stunts to reveal the tricks of the thieves' trade, and also accompanying police on raids and talking to amateur detectives and have-a-go heroes who fought back in the name of justice. Plus, Shaw Taylor tries to reunite theft victims with what is rightfully theirs, and there are appeals for information on the nation's most wanted criminals

programme.title: Benidorm ER
programme.desc: The documentary returns after a mid-series break. Tests reveal a heart attack after a 48-year-old from Glasgow is rushed in with chest pains, while Dr Torres treats a West Midlands woman struggling for breath and thinks the situation is serious enough for her to be admitted to hospital. A severely visually impaired man from Aberdeen explains what it is like to receive medical attention for a suspected broken arm from people he cannot see and in a language he does not understand, while a Norwegian visitor arrives at the ER with a gash on her wrist caused by the shattering of a glass shower door

programme.title: Holiday Love Rats Exposed
programme.desc: Documentary telling the stories of Brits who have been conned out of tens of thousands of pounds and left broken-hearted by people preying on single holiday-makers looking for love. Jeannette was swept off her feet by Rudiger in Sorrento, Italy, and over the next nine months spent Â£20,000 on him, only to discover he was wanted in several countries for duping women. Jane met Nigerian Michael in a Gambian nightclub and during their brief marriage gave him so much money she ended up bankrupt - unaware he was already in a long-term relationship

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called in when a woman is admitted to hospital after being found in a distressed state on a bus, claiming to have been raped. She tells the detectives it is the fourth time she has been assaulted by the same man over the past 15 years, but runs off before they get to ask any more questions. Crime drama, guest starring Jennifer Love Hewitt

programme.title: Body of Proof
programme.desc: Ethan is conducting a post-mortem examination when he has to step out of the room for a minute and returns to find the body has gone. The supposedly dead man is found wandering the offices still very much alive and claiming he was shot by his room-mate - who is later found dead in the back of a bin wagon. Megan's investigation leads her to a shocking cover-up at local government level

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The murder of a cigar-maker leads to some surprising facts being uncovered about the victim. The team's enquiries turn up a surprising connection to Cuba, Fidel Castro and a hidden, bloody past. Elsewhere, Tim and Calleigh are convinced a woman is guilty of killing a man next to a cash machine - but struggle to find enough evidence to prove it

programme.title: SuperCasino

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: Lisa's epilepsy is so severe it could kill her and the frequency of her seizures means she is virtually housebound. Neurosurgeons at Liverpool's Walton Centre offer her the option of brain surgery that represents her last hope of leading a more normal life with her husband and young daughter. Simon has a tumour growing on his pituitary gland that is pressing on his optic nerves and needs an emergency operation to remove it and save his eyesight, but the procedure is highly intricate and could damage his vision

programme.title: House Doctor
programme.desc: A look back at some of the past transformations from the series in which interior designer Ann Maurice visits houses and offers advice on making them attractive to would-be buyers

programme.title: House Doctor

programme.desc: Historian Allan Chapman discusses Isaac Newton's revolutionary theories, which postulated that the universe is governed by a set of mathematical principles. Alex Polizzi tries to turn their struggling business around, but has her work cut out to prove to the owners that a failing hotel is not a laughing matter

programme.title: Kidnapped
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the abduction of a teenager from her home in Salt Lake City in 2002. The search for the girl turned into a nationwide media frenzy, but nine months later as hope was fading, she was found alive and well in the company of an unbalanced couple. Starring Amber Marshall, Dylan Baker and Lindsay Frost. Edited for violence and language

Biker cop Lucy Watson has a hunch about a car that she pulls over in Essex - and a broken rear light leads to a discovery that casts doubt over the driver's right to be in the UK. Last in the series

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: While on medical leave, Ducky reopens a 12-year-old case by talking officials at a cemetery into releasing the body of a Navy commander whose post-mortem he carried out 12 years previously. Meanwhile, the team is called in to investigate the death of a sergeant from carbon monoxide poisoning - and finds a copy of Ducky's exhumation request on the man's laptop. Crime drama, starring David McCallum

programme.title: Suspects
programme.desc: Jack and Charlie investigate an assault on the owner of the Green Pit nightclub in east London and discover the victim's sister unconscious in the cellar, with blood pouring from a head wound. The detectives' efforts to piece together what happened are hampered by the lack of CCTV footage, and the case takes a confusing turn when a 19-year-old student is found dead with a flyer for the club in his pocket. Crime drama, starring Damien Molony and Clare-Hope Ashitey

programme.title: World's Toughest Prison
programme.desc: One-off documentary revealing the technological advances that have enabled North Branch Correctional Institute in Maryland, USA, to become one of the most secure prisons in the world, holding more than 1,400 of America's most dangerous convicts. Surprisingly, the building was made possible thanks to historic engineering breakthroughs at four earlier prisons - including the Tower of London and Alcatraz Island - each of which featured an innovation that allowed engineers to build even more secure facilities. Now, with its impenetrable cells able to withstand bomb blasts and technology ensuring dangerous inmates are kept safely away from each other, North Branch may be the toughest yet

programme.title: Ben Fogle
programme.desc: The adventurer journeys to a remote part of Leyte, one of the 7,000 tropical islands that make up the Philippines, to spend time with Neil Hoag, a 45-year-old former taxi driver from Florida. Ben joins the coconut farmer and his young family in their hillside bamboo house to experience daily life in a harsh and unforgiving climate, discovering why Neil ditched the hunt for the American dream

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Evelyn walks out of a party after Matt tries to kiss her, while Josh gets back together with Maddy, but Andy threatens to come between them when he spikes her drink. Zac reacts badly when Hannah invites Nate home for dinner, and Roo returns from the city, unaware Marilyn and John are now a couple

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Brad blames Mason for the abseiling accident after the doctor tells him it's unlikely Josh will ever swim competitively again. Kate is flustered by Brennan's sudden appearance in Erinsborough and decides to keep details of her private life vague, but Paul reveals she is currently nursing a broken heart

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part story, the entire team is put in danger while hunting for the killer of a former NCIS agent. Jenny Shepard calls in Mike Franks for help, afraid she too is a target - and convinced Gibbs will be next. American crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Michael Weatherly

programme.title: Seduced by Lies (2010)
programme.desc: Premiere. A woman hopes to make a fresh start with a new relationship in defiance of her father's wishes, and turns her back on old friends when they are suspicious of her boyfriend. However, she gradually comes to realise that he has a shady past and is not as perfect as he appears. Thriller, starring Josie Davis and Marc Menard. Edited for sexual content

programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Neighbours
programme.desc: Brad blames Mason for the abseiling accident after the doctor tells him it's unlikely Josh will ever swim competitively again. programme.title: NewsTalk Live
programme.desc: Topical debate and in-depth analysis of the day's major stories, with experts discussing the key talking points of the issues making the headlines and viewers also having the chance to give their opinions. Presented by Emma Crosby

programme.title: A Right Royal Scandal
programme.desc: Documentary looking at some of the incidents involving the royal family that have made media headlines around the world, including the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, in 1997 after her car crashed while being pursued by the paparazzi in Paris. The programme also reflects on the fuss that ensued after the publication of topless pictures of the Duchess of Cambridge sunbathing on holiday, as well as photos of Prince Harry playing strip billiards in Las Vegas. Narrated by Alistair Appleton

programme.title: Henry VIII & Anne
programme.desc: Part one of two. Historian Suzannah Lipscomb examines the extraordinary story of the tumultuous love affair between Henry VIII and Anne Boleyn, beginning by exploring the seven-year courtship of the royal couple. Using dramatic reconstructions and first-hand accounts, she delves into their backgrounds and personalities, searching for the triggers - personal and political - that would lead to their falling in love

programme.title: The Hotel Inspector
programme.desc: Alex Polizzi visits Eden Lodge in the popular holiday and sailing resort of Falmouth in Cornwall, booking into the B&B as a guest to gain an impression of the average customer experience. She is not impressed by owners Lynn and Ziggy's self-decorated bedrooms and the condition of their indoor swimming pool, and decides they need a serious wake-up call if they are to operate at a profit

programme.title: Brain Hospital
programme.desc: Michael Jenkinson operates on 34-year-old Steffan to remove a tumour and has to keep him conscious throughout the surgery to avoid damaging the part of his brain controlling his left arm and hand. Professor Paul Eldridge asks 45-year-old dress-maker Anita to make a choice over whether to go ahead with a risky procedure, while 19-year-old Bethany undergoes a programme of intensive neurological rehabilitation after suffering a brain haemorrhage that has caused lasting damage to her eyesight and voice

programme.title: My Face Is Eating Me Alive
programme.desc: The return of the programme documenting tales of remarkable human experiences from around the world, beginning with a Zimbabwean woman seeking treatment for her daughter's facial tumour. Tare's ordeal started eight years ago when she was 13 and had toothache. Her mother Thandiwe could not afford dental treatment and an aggressive swelling on the teenager's upper left jaw began to restrict her airways and push her jaw out of her mouth. Help eventually arrived from charities Saving Faces and Girl Child Network Worldwide and from a UK surgeon who volunteered to operate on Tare

programme.title: SuperCasino

programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents the life and work of the Western world's most gifted artists, beginning with Giotto di Bondone, the son of a Tuscan shepherd. Detective drama, starring Peter Falk and Robert Culp

programme.desc: Richard Hammond gets behind the wheel of the mid-engined Alfa Romeo 4C on the shores of Lake Como in Italy - but his enjoyment of the lightweight vehicle is disturbed by the arrival of Jeremy Clarkson, who demands a race against his quad bike. Jeremy also visits Belgium, putting the McLaren P1 hypercar to the test in Bruges and around the Spa-Francorchamps Formula One circuit - and its combined power output of more than 900bhp generated from electricity and turbocharged petrol V8 power is likely to cause astonishment. Meanwhile, James May spends time at Camp Bastion in Afghanistan to learn about the army's vehicle redeployment efforts, and Thor star Tom Hiddleston tries to coax the best time he can muster from the Reasonably Priced Car

programme.title: Tough Young Teachers
programme.desc: The trainees approach the end of their first academic year, and must decide whether to stay in the teaching profession. Second-year student Chloe faces the dilemma of whether to pursue her ambition to travel, while Nick contemplates leaving Harefield Academy to be closer to his wife-to-be. Meanwhile, the teachers discover if they have made an impact on their students when the exam results are released. Last in the series

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents
programme.desc: Twenty-somethings Agi and Billy embark on their first unsupervised holiday to the Thai island of Koh Samui, unaware their parents are covertly monitoring them. Agi's family does not drink and are surprised to see her partying, while Billy's mother know nothing of his wild social life and his holiday antics cause her some embarrassment

programme.title: Bad Education
programme.desc: The Abbey Grove School election gets under way, and Alfie makes it his mission to prove Miss Gulliver wrong after she implies that none of his class members is suitable. Meanwhile, Fraser is suspended following an unfortunate incident involving a provocative internet viral. Starring Jack Whitehall, Sarah Solemani and Mathew Horne. Last in the series

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is shocked by an unexpected visitor berating her for what she has done - although she is not the only resident of the Square surprised by the new arrival. Jane notices Ian is placing a lot of pressure on Bobby, leading to an argument between the former couple that is only made worse when Jane discovers the real reason her ex-husband invited her to stay. Linda feels inspired to help the market traders in their fight against the council and rallies the troops for a demonstration, while Masood realises Shabnam hasn't got over the separation

programme.desc: Stan uses CIA brainwashing techniques to stop Hayley leaving for France, but realises he will face deadly consequences unless he relinquishes his power over her. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger become private detectives

programme.title: Is Amanda Knox Guilty?
programme.desc: Having last month been found guilty for a second time by an Italian court for the murder of British student Meredith Kercher, Amanda Knox - who now resides in her native US - faces the prospect of extradition to serve a 28-year sentence. This documentary charts the evolution of the case - from Knox's original conviction and four years in prison, to her successful appeal in 2011 - and outlines the evidence that supports and contradicts her claims of innocence

programme.title: Cinderellas of the Slums
programme.desc: Billie JD Porter travels to Brazil to explore the glitz and glamour of 15th birthday debutante balls. In the country's booming economy, some parents are spending more than 300,000 reals on their daughters' special day - but the huge gap between rich and poor means not everyone is invited to the party. Billie teams up with two modern-day Cinderellas who are hoping their dreams of making it to the ball will come true. Last in the series

programme.title: The Truth About Webcam Girls
programme.desc: Documentary providing an insight into the world of adult webcamming, meeting three online models to find out what it's like baring all for strangers around the world. Former porn star Sammie, 25, has starred in more than 100 adult movies, but her experiences in the industry have left her emotionally scarred, while 24-year-old Carla is willing to try most things in her line of work, and has learned much about men's secret desires. Ambitious glamour model Olivia, 24, refuses to go fully nude, but faces fierce competition from those willing to strip off for the camera

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter's plans to form an anti-immigration group are quickly put on hold when he discovers he was born in Mexico. Unable to prove his citizenship, pass the naturalisation test or convince investigators his marriage to Lois is legitimate, he is forced to work for Carter as a gardener, and becomes a campaigner for immigration rights

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Meg falls for the attractive medical student treating her for injuries sustained in a flood - to the dismay of an overprotective Peter, who immediately sets out to nip their relationship in the bud

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine becomes a surrogate mother for gay neighbours Terry and Greg, prompting an outraged Stan to kidnap the baby once she is born. Meanwhile, Steve and Roger think Klaus is out to get them

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Stan returns home from another dangerous mission to find Francine and the family have decorated the house for Christmas. In the country's booming economy, some parents are spending more than 300,000 reals on their daughters' special day - but the huge gap between rich and poor means not everyone is invited to the party. Billie teams up with two modern-day Cinderellas who are hoping their dreams of making it to the ball will come true. Last in the series

programme.title: The Truth About Webcam Girls
programme.desc: Documentary providing an insight into the world of adult webcamming, meeting three online models to find out what it's like baring all for strangers around the world. Former porn star Sammie, 25, has starred in more than 100 adult movies, but her experiences in the industry have left her emotionally scarred, while 24-year-old Carla is willing to try most things in her line of work, and has learned much about men's secret desires. Ambitious glamour model Olivia, 24, refuses to go fully nude, but faces fierce competition from those willing to strip off for the camera

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: An infamous music producer misleads Andy into thinking Rage Records wishes to sign him and Errol, which in fact only the youngster is wanted. Later, a series of unfortunate events throws the custody case into jeopardy. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott. Last in the series

programme.title: Cinderellas of the Slums
programme.desc: Billie JD Porter travels to Brazil to explore the glitz and glamour of 15th birthday debutante balls. In the country's booming economy, some parents are spending more than 300,000 reals on their daughters' special day - but the huge gap between rich and poor means not everyone is invited to the party. Billie teams up with two modern-day Cinderellas who are hoping their dreams of making it to the ball will come true. Last in the series

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Adventure game show in which 20 men and women travel to Argentina to compete in physically demanding challenges on a purpose-built obstacle course. Contestants include a man who claims he will one day be prime minister. Richard Hammond presents from the safety of the studio, while Amanda Byram is on the spot to meet the contestants

programme.title: Traffic Cops
programme.desc: The work of Yorkshire's Regional Roads Crime Team, who are using headcams as a new tool to collect evidence. A drugs dealer is faced with a police search on camera and a first-time offender speeds away from the cops in his wife's car, so the officers take off in pursuit. A drunk-driver is rudely woken by the police in a hotel car park, leading to an unexpected find

programme.title: The White Slums
programme.desc: New series. Presenter Reggie Yates travels to South Africa 20 years after the first democratic elections and in the shadow of former president Nelson Mandela's death to explore three different communities. He lives in each of them for a week in the hope of discovering more about the country in the 21st century, beginning by visiting a squatter camp in Coronation Park, outside of Johannesburg, mostly populated by Afrikaners. Youth charities claim that up to 400,000 white residents now live below the poverty line, leading to questions being raised about growing inequality in the country

programme.title: Ja'mie
programme.desc: The schoolgirl arranges for Kwami to move in with her family for a month to demonstrate Christian charity in a bid to be awarded the Hillford School Medal. Later, she takes things to the next level with Mitchell at her prefect party. Comedy, starring Chris Lilley

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Kat is unable to give up on Stacey so Alfie takes her to visit Luke, who has some worrying information about her cousin. As police and news crews turn up for the market traders' protest, Denise, Peter and Lucy are frustrated that Ian is failing to show his support - but he is more worried about what Jane will do following their argument. Aleks gets Tamwar to do his dirty work, while Masood provides moral support to Shabnam by escorting her to a job interview

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter puts out a fire at a fast-food restaurant and earns the gratitude of the owner, who rewards him with an unlimited supply of free burgers - with disastrous consequences for his health. Animation following the misadventures of America's disaster-prone Griffin family

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Peter loses his wallet at a Barry Manilow concert, where it is found by actor James Woods, who is intent on revenge and uses it to steal his identity - not to mention Lois and the children

programme.title: American Dad!
programme.desc: Francine pretends to kidnap Roger after he has a fight with Stan, hoping to demonstrate how much he means to the family. However, when her agent husband refuses to pay the ransom, the alien is forced to rethink the way he treats people

programme.title: Ja'mie
programme.desc: The schoolgirl arranges for Kwami to move in with her family for a month to demonstrate Christian charity in a bid to be awarded the Hillford School Medal. Later, she takes things to the next level with Mitchell at her prefect party. Comedy, starring Chris Lilley

programme.title: The White Slums
programme.desc: Presenter Reggie Yates travels to South Africa 20 years after the first democratic elections and in the shadow of former president Nelson Mandela's death to explore three different communities. He lives in each of them for a week in the hope of discovering more about the country in the 21st century, beginning by visiting a squatter camp in Coronation Park, outside of Johannesburg, mostly populated by Afrikaners. Youth charities claim that up to 400,000 white residents now live below the poverty line, leading to questions being raised about growing inequality in the country

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Russell Kane hosts the comedy show featuring an ensemble of up-and-coming talent, blending stand-up routines, short films, sketches and music. In his latest serving he explains why the British like to be unhappy, and Totally Tom become tour guides. Linda the Make-Up Girl inflicts some unconventional beauty treatments on Marcel Lucont

programme.title: Russell Howard's Good News
programme.desc: The comedian offers his perspective on the London Mayoral elections, and is joined by a mystery guest who has featured in the news. Plus, members of the audience are invited on to the People's Podium, and the show ends with a heart-warming tale. From April 2012

programme.title: Is Amanda Knox Guilty?
programme.desc: Having last month been found guilty for a second time by an Italian court for the murder of British student Meredith Kercher, Amanda Knox - who now resides in her native US - faces the prospect of extradition to serve a 28-year sentence. This documentary charts the evolution of the case - from Knox's original conviction and four years in prison, to her successful appeal in 2011 - and outlines the evidence that supports and contradicts her claims of innocence

programme.title: Great Movie Mistakes
programme.desc: A selection of blunders evident in Hollywood films, presented by Matthew Crosby, Ben Clark and Tom Parry from comedy troupe Pappy's. Featuring foul-ups including camera crews in shot, continuity errors, anachronisms and plot holes

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The people of a Victorian Yorkshire mill town are terrified when bodies start washing up from the river, bright red and wax-like - but with the Doctor and Clara nowhere to be seen, it's up to lizard detective Madame Vastra - last seen in 2012 Christmas special The Snowmen - and her sidekicks Jenny and Strax to take centre stage as they attempt to get to the bottom of the mystery. It seems the answer lies behind the imposing gates of Sweetville mill, owned by the plain-speaking Mrs Gillyflower. Diana Rigg and her real-life daughter Rachael Stirling guest star, with Catrin Stewart, Neve McIntosh and Dan Starkey as the Time Lord's Earth-bound investigative pals

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The Doctor and Clara have ended up with a couple of extra companions, whose first trip in the Tardis brings them to Hedgewick's World of Wonders, once known as the greatest theme park in the galaxy. Sadly it has seen better days and is now home to a shabby showman, a chess-playing dwarf and a dysfunctional army platoon. However, there is an even bigger surprise in store for the Time Lord with the re-emergence of one of his oldest foes - the Cybermen are back, and they're deadlier than ever. Warwick Davis, Tamzin Outhwaite and Jason Watkins guest

programme.title: Meet the Fockers (2004)
programme.desc: A hapless groom-to-be appears to have finally won the approval of his stern prospective in-laws, but faces a new challenge when he takes them on a vacation to Florida to meet his free-spirited sex therapist mother and eccentric house-husband father. The tension rapidly mounts as the mismatched families struggle to get along. Comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman and Barbra Streisand

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Lois is forced to find a job when the family's domestic finances are stretched. She is discovered by a voiceover talent agent named Randy who runs an adult-only phone line and pays his employees generously for services rendered. As she settles into her new role, she gets a surprise call. Meanwhile, Peter acquires a pet falcon

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: An unfortunate sky-diving accident leaves Peter in hospital, where he meets a man named Mahmoud. However, Quagmire and Joe are suspicious of the charismatic newcomer's motives, especially when Peter unexpectedly converts to Islam and is given a free mobile phone. Animated comedy, featuring the guest voice of Omid Abtahi

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Russell Kane hosts the comedy show featuring an ensemble of up-and-coming UK talent. Two Episodes of Mash spot a familiar looking face in the crowd, Marcel Lucont delivers another coming-of-age tale set in France, and Sharonetti and Elanio plot the demise of Daveutio in The Only Way Is Shakespeare

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Comedy show, presented by Russell Kane, featuring a blend of stand-up routines, short films and music. The host encounters trouble in paradise, the prime minister finds himself distracted from a world crisis in WitTank's sketch, and backstage crew members Totally Tom finally end up at the front of the stage. Last in the series

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: An infamous music producer misleads Andy into thinking Rage Records wishes to sign him and Errol, which in fact only the youngster is wanted. Later, a series of unfortunate events throws the custody case into jeopardy. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott. Last in the series

programme.title: Ja'mie
programme.desc: The schoolgirl arranges for Kwami to move in with her family for a month to demonstrate Christian charity in a bid to be awarded the Hillford School Medal. Later, she takes things to the next level with Mitchell at her prefect party. Comedy, starring Chris Lilley

programme.title: Sun, Sex and Suspicious Parents
programme.desc: Twenty-somethings Agi and Billy embark on their first unsupervised holiday to the Thai island of Koh Samui, unaware their parents are covertly monitoring them. Agi's family does not drink and are surprised to see her partying, while Billy's mother know nothing of his wild social life and his holiday antics cause her some embarrassment

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Russell Kane hosts the comedy show featuring an ensemble of up-and-coming UK talent. Two Episodes of Mash spot a familiar looking face in the crowd, Marcel Lucont delivers another coming-of-age tale set in France, and Sharonetti and Elanio plot the demise of Daveutio in The Only Way Is Shakespeare

programme.title: Live at the Electric
programme.desc: Comedy show, presented by Russell Kane, featuring a blend of stand-up routines, short films and music. The host encounters trouble in paradise, the prime minister finds himself distracted from a world crisis in WitTank's sketch, and backstage crew members Totally Tom finally end up at the front of the stage. Last in the series

programme.title: Uncle
programme.desc: An infamous music producer misleads Andy into thinking Rage Records wishes to sign him and Errol, which in fact only the youngster is wanted. Later, a series of unfortunate events throws the custody case into jeopardy. Comedy, starring Nick Helm and Elliot Speller-Gillott. Last in the series

programme.title: Great Movie Mistakes
programme.desc: A selection of blunders evident in Hollywood films, presented by Matthew Crosby, Ben Clark and Tom Parry from comedy troupe Pappy's. Featuring foul-ups including camera crews in shot, continuity errors, anachronisms and plot holes

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Clara receives a letter summoning her to a mysterious meeting, where she is given a message for the Doctor. The meaning is uncertain, but when an enemy strikes the Time Lord is left with no choice but to travel to the one place in time and space he should never go - into a deadly trap that threatens to unravel his past, present and future. Matt Smith and Jenna-Louise Coleman star, with Alex Kingston returning as River Song. Last in the series

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Part two of two. Matt Smith and Jenna Coleman take an in-depth look at the sci-fi show, focussing on the seventh to the 11th Time Lords, plus their various companions and enemies. Featuring contributions by David Tennant, Paul McGann, Sylvester McCoy, Noel Clarke, Rick Edwards, Konnie Huq and McFly

programme.title: Little Fockers (2010)
programme.desc: Nurse Greg is now the proud father of twins, but has yet to earn the respect of his wife's stern father after 10 years of marriage. The couple invite both sides of their extended family to the kids' birthday party, where Greg makes a desperate effort to finally prove his worth to his father-in-law. Comedy sequel, with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson and Dustin Hoffman

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Brian and Jillian move in together, but Stewie interferes with their relationship. Meanwhile, Meg and Chris get jobs at a local convenience store, but she finds herself facing unfair treatment in the workplace. With the voice of Drew Barrymore

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Joe begins to feel his disability is holding Bonnie back from living a full life, and decides to get a leg transplant. Excited about his new ability to walk, he takes up extreme sports, ditching his current friends for more active ones, and upsetting a jilted Peter

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part one of two. Angry and resentful at being left behind while his parents set sail on a luxury cruise, Stewie arms himself with a machine gun and gives chase in a speedboat, intent on murdering Lois

programme.title: Family Guy
programme.desc: Part two of two. As Joe leads a manhunt around Quahog, Lois returns to identify her would-be killer. Meanwhile, hell-bent on domination, Stewie takes extreme action to claim the title of supreme ruler of the world

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Reel History of Britain
programme.desc: Melvyn Bragg takes his vintage mobile cinema to Soho to look back to the 1950s, the decade that gave birth to the teenager. Singer Marty Wilde explains how the new music scene brightened up post-war Britain, and former `wild man of rock' Wee Willie Harris reminisces about the rowdy youths who dominated the dance floors

programme.title: Weird Nature
programme.desc: Exploring incredible creatures capable of amazing feats using just their bodies, beginning with a look at the common pearl caterpillar that can roll itself into a ball and wheel along at speed, and bushbabies that bounce along like rubber balls

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: New series. Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how having a skeleton has helped vertebrates to colonise and dominate almost every habitat on Earth. He begins his journey by looking at the influence of bones on size, revealing how they are capable of supporting large animals, with the strongest bone able to withstand 109 tons of pressure

programme.title: Dissected
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary in which a team of anatomy experts, led by Dr George McGavin, dissects a real human hand - and uncovers why it is unique in the animal kingdom. They find out how hands provide power and precision, and talk to individuals who use theirs in unique ways, including magicians and rock climbers

programme.title: Blink
programme.desc: Kevin Fong looks back through 40 years of Horizon archives to explore what science has revealed about methods of perception. He discovers why babies use touch more than any other sense, how vision can easily be tricked, and the ways technological advancements are getting closer to being able to replace human faculties if they fail

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: Examining the heartland of the country, home to ancient structures such as the Great Wall and modern buildings like Beijing's Olympic Stadium, as well as animals including the giant panda and golden snub-nosed monkey. However, the region holds even deeper cultural significance as the land of origin of China's most populous ethnic group the Han people - whose 5,000-year-old traditions are increasingly under threat

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of South America
programme.desc: Dr Jago Cooper embarks on a journey to discover the history of some of South America's ancient civilisations, beginning with the Chachapoya people of the Peruvian Andes. He reveals how they developed sophisticated methods of recording stories, traded in exotic goods found hundreds of miles from their territory and had funeral traditions that challenge assumptions about past human behaviour

programme.title: The World's Most Beautiful Eggs
programme.desc: Stephen Smith explores the life and work of the renowned jeweller, best known for the eggs he made out of precious metals and gemstones for the last tsars of Russia. The presenter talks to Prince Michael of Kent about Faberge items in the Royal Collection, and to Russian oligarch Viktor Vekselberg, who spent $100million acquiring nine of the trinkets. He also follows in Faberge's footsteps, from the Green Vaults in Dresden to the corridors of the Kremlin museum, to discover how a modest family business was turned into the world's most famous supplier of luxury items

programme.title: Weird Nature
programme.desc: Exploring incredible creatures capable of amazing feats using just their bodies, beginning with a look at the common pearl caterpillar that can roll itself into a ball and wheel along at speed, and bushbabies that bounce along like rubber balls

programme.title: Secrets of Bones
programme.desc: Evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod explores how having a skeleton has helped vertebrates to colonise and dominate almost every habitat on Earth. He begins his journey by looking at the influence of bones on size, revealing how they are capable of supporting large animals, with the strongest bone able to withstand 109 tons of pressure

programme.title: Dissected
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary in which a team of anatomy experts, led by Dr George McGavin, dissects a real human hand - and uncovers why it is unique in the animal kingdom. They find out how hands provide power and precision, and talk to individuals who use theirs in unique ways, including magicians and rock climbers

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Reel History of Britain
programme.desc: Melvyn Bragg takes his vintage cinema to the Queen's Lancashire Regiment Museum and Barracks in Preston, where he looks back at the First World War. Richard Bell talks about his great-uncle Donald who received the highest award for valour during the Battle of the Somme in 1916, Les Bond describes the sacrifices made by his home town of Accrington's Pals battalion, and Rita Humphrey tells the story of her uncle Walter Tull - the first black officer in the British Army

programme.title: Ancient Greece
programme.desc: Dr Michael Scott explores the role played by the Romans in the preservation of Greek drama, discovering how they adapted it to their own ends. Plus, he reveals how the empire served as a vital link between modern drama and the plays of the ancient Greeks. With contributions by professors Matthew Leigh, Tim Whitmarsh and Gesine Manuwald. Last in the series

programme.title: Infested
programme.desc: Documentary in which Michael Mosley attempts to gain a greater understanding of people's relationship with parasites, which exist in almost every animal on Earth. He discovers that while some of them are dangerous to human health, there is growing scientific evidence that a selection of parasites may actually be beneficial

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Leslie decides to bury a time capsule about life in Pawnee, but receives an odd suggestion from a local man, which causes unexpected consequences. comedy, starring Amy Poehler

programme.title: Parks and Recreation
programme.desc: Ron decides to get back together with Tammy after breaking up with Tom's ex-wife, while Leslie and Ben try to enlist the help of the local police ahead of the Harvest Festival. Comedy, starring Amy Poehler, Aziz Ansari, Rashida Jones and Nick Offerman

programme.title: Amazon Abyss
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike deGruy and Kate Humble chart the depths of the river system in search of the unusual creatures that live there. The bottom of the Amazon remains largely unexplored, and a team of divers employs powerful underwater lights and high-definition cameras to seek out its inhabitants. However, the expedition holds many dangers - strong currents, waters thick with sediment and predators including anacondas, caimans and piranhas. Among the species featured is the knifefish, which navigates in the darkness by electrical impulses, and the giant jau, which is regarded with fear by the local people. First shown in 2005

programme.title: Michael Grade and the World's Oldest Joke
programme.desc: The broadcast executive traces the history of the joke with a little help from a host of historians, academics, comedy experts and stand-ups including Ken Dodd, Tim Vine and Barry Cryer. Along the way he discovers what tickled the Tudors, ribbed the Romans and made Renaissance wits roar as he sets out to discover whether jokes come and go with the rise and fall of civilisations, or whether people are still laughing at the same things their ancestors did

programme.title: Bunkers, Brutalism and Bloodymindedness
programme.desc: Jonathan Meades presents a two-part documentary that celebrates 20th-century Brutalist architecture, which typically takes the form of block-like concrete constructions. In the first edition, he traces its origins in the Martial architecture of the Second World War, the Modern Gothic style - widely despised during the Victorian era - and even further back in the time of John Vanbrugh

programme.title: Ancient Greece
programme.desc: Dr Michael Scott explores the role played by the Romans in the preservation of Greek drama, discovering how they adapted it to their own ends. Plus, he reveals how the empire served as a vital link between modern drama and the plays of the ancient Greeks. With contributions by professors Matthew Leigh, Tim Whitmarsh and Gesine Manuwald. Last in the series

programme.title: Infested
programme.desc: Documentary in which Michael Mosley attempts to gain a greater understanding of people's relationship with parasites, which exist in almost every animal on Earth. He discovers that while some of them are dangerous to human health, there is growing scientific evidence that a selection of parasites may actually be beneficial

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell presents an edition first broadcast on February 15, 1979. Includes performances by the Dooleys, Generation X, Alan Price, Pretenders, Lene Lovich, the Three Degrees, the Skids and Blondie. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's cricket team is a man short and he knows Paul is a very good player - as do the rest of the side and they all want him in, even if it means they can't play themselves. Can he bring himself to pick his arch-enemy? Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Paul Egan

programme.title: Britain on Film
programme.desc: Documentary examining the transformations in British agriculture during the 1960s, revealing how the Rank Organisation captured the new technologies and production methods that were changing the face of farming. The clips also demonstrate how country life adapted to the moral and financial realities of a modernising nation

programme.title: The Brits Who Built the Modern World
programme.desc: A look at the 1980s when contemporary architecture was unpopular and under attack from the Prince of Wales. British architects discuss the stories behind their most famous creations including Richard Rogers' Lloyd's of London building and Norman Foster's Stansted Airport. Terry Farrell reveals how he was kept in the dark while working on the MI6 Headquarters, and Michael Hopkins recalls the challenges of bringing modern design into the traditional world of Lord's Cricket Ground

programme.title: The Man Who Fought the Planners
programme.desc: Documentary charting the career of opinionated journalist and architectural critic Ian Nairn. In 1955, his attack on the soulless destruction of Britain by post-war planners was published in the Architectural Review and was influential in the formation of the Civic Trust. Over the next two decades, he became a passionate campaigner and inspired a whole generation to take up arms against the second-rate buildings in towns and cities. Includes tributes from colleagues and admirers including Jonathan Meades, Gillian Darley and Jonathan Glancey

programme.title: Dissected
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary in which a team of anatomy experts, led by Dr George McGavin, dissects a real human hand - and uncovers why it is unique in the animal kingdom. They find out how hands provide power and precision, and talk to individuals who use theirs in unique ways, including magicians and rock climbers

programme.title: The Life of Rock with Brian Pern
programme.desc: The host profiles a selection of rock stars who, like himself, applied their creative energies to acting, charity singles and protest songs. Plus, former Top of the Pops presenter Noel Edmonds reveals how Russians tried to take down the aircraft carrying Phil Collins from Wembley to Philadelphia during Live Aid in 1985. Spoof rock documentary, starring Simon Day

programme.title: Top of the Pops
programme.desc: Peter Powell presents an edition first broadcast on February 15, 1979. Includes performances by the Dooleys, Generation X, Alan Price, Pretenders, Lene Lovich, the Three Degrees, the Skids and Blondie. Plus, dance sequences by Legs & Co

programme.title: Dreaming the Impossible
programme.desc: Architectural investigator Dr Olivia Horsfall Turner looks at two of the most radical civil engineering projects proposed in the last century and explores how international politics and vested interests derailed plans to better connect the country to Europe. She discusses the idea to cut Scotland in half during the early 1900s to create a warship canal, and the many attempts to construct the Channel Tunnel

programme.title: Ever Decreasing Circles
programme.desc: Martin's cricket team is a man short and he knows Paul is a very good player - as do the rest of the side and they all want him in, even if it means they can't play themselves. Can he bring himself to pick his arch-enemy? Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Paul Egan

programme.title: The Brits Who Built the Modern World
programme.desc: A look at the 1980s when contemporary architecture was unpopular and under attack from the Prince of Wales. British architects discuss the stories behind their most famous creations including Richard Rogers' Lloyd's of London building and Norman Foster's Stansted Airport. Terry Farrell reveals how he was kept in the dark while working on the MI6 Headquarters, and Michael Hopkins recalls the challenges of bringing modern design into the traditional world of Lord's Cricket Ground

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories

programme.title: Transatlantic Sessions
programme.desc: Hosts Aly Bain, Jerry Douglas and their resident house band are joined by American bluegrass musician Russ Barenberg and Bellshill-born fiddle player John McCusker in the show's studios overlooking Loch Lomond

programme.title: Sound of Cinema
programme.desc: Neil Brand looks at how developing technology has taken film soundtracks in new directions and changed perceptions on how they should be made. He tries his hand at playing a theremin, the early Russian instrument that Miklos Rozsa used to evoke a sense of psychological disturbance in Alfred Hitchcock's movies and talks to Vangelis, who shares his inspiration for the Chariots of Fire and Blade Runner scores. The presenter also interviews Walter Murch and Carter Burwell, before Clint Mansell explains how electronic technology allowed him to become an acclaimed composer despite his lack of formal musical training. Last in the series

programme.title: BB King - The Life of Riley
programme.desc: The American blues singer-songwriter, now 88, recounts his story of a rise to prominence in the music industry, earning him the title `King of the Blues'. Born into a world of oppression in the cotton plantations outside Berclair, Mississippi, he went on to assemble his own band under the guidance of Millard Lee and found widespread popularity with his Singin' the Blues album in the Elvis-charged swinging zeitgeist of 1956. His prolificacy showed no bounds, and more than half a century later he released his 42nd studio album, One Kind Favor, by which time he was well into his eighties - and showing no sign of giving up. Filmed in locations across the States, as well as the United Kingdom, and featuring contributions by a range of fellow musicians including Eric Clapton, Bono, George Benson and Mick Hucknall. Narrated by Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Blues at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of blues performances from the past 50 years. Featuring famous songs by Son House, the Kinks, BB King, John Lee Hooker and Eric Clapton, plus lesser-known tracks by Freddie King, Delaney & Bonnie and Long John Baldry

programme.title: Blues America
programme.desc: Part one of two. A look at the early years of blues music, a genre which began as a form of black pop, to discover how Bessie Smith, Blind Lemon Jefferson and Charlie Patton used the latest media to bring their sound to the public. With contributions from Keith Richards, Taj Mahal and Chuck D

programme.title: Blues America
programme.desc: Concluding part, looking at blues music in the postwar period, when artists like Muddy Waters, Robert Johnson, Howlin' Wolf and John Lee Hooker rooted the genre firmly in the cities, where it contributed to the de-segregation of America by spawning rock 'n' roll. As it moved from black to white audiences, arguments developed about what was the real authentic blues. With contributions from Keith Richards, Bonnie Raitt, Seasick Steve and Buddy Guy

programme.title: BB King - The Life of Riley
programme.desc: The American blues singer-songwriter, now 88, recounts his story of a rise to prominence in the music industry, earning him the title `King of the Blues'. Born into a world of oppression in the cotton plantations outside Berclair, Mississippi, he went on to assemble his own band under the guidance of Millard Lee and found widespread popularity with his Singin' the Blues album in the Elvis-charged swinging zeitgeist of 1956. His prolificacy showed no bounds, and more than half a century later he released his 42nd studio album, One Kind Favor, by which time he was well into his eighties - and showing no sign of giving up. Filmed in locations across the States, as well as the United Kingdom, and featuring contributions by a range of fellow musicians including Eric Clapton, Bono, George Benson and Mick Hucknall. Narrated by Morgan Freeman

programme.title: Sounds of the 70s 2 Troubadours - Peaceful Easy Feeling
programme.desc: Archive performances by a selection of artists who emerged from California in the early part of the decade, a time when the UK was familiarising itself with the introduction of decimalisation and enduring a series of industrial disputes. Featuring Neil Young, Joni Mitchell, James Taylor, Crosby & Nash, America, Carole King, Eagles and Seals & Crofts

programme.title: Wild China
programme.desc: The series concludes with a visit to the country's eastern seaboard to investigate how the Chinese government is managing environmental concerns while meeting the ever-expanding needs of the population. Among the region's diverse locales lie futuristic cities, seaweed-thatched villages and rugged wetlands that are home to some of the world's rarest animal species. Last in the series

programme.title: Lost Kingdoms of South America
programme.desc: The series revealing the character of the continent's ancient peoples continues, as archaeologist Dr Jago Cooper investigates the origins of Tiwanaku - the 13,000ft-high ruins of a monolithic temple city. His search takes him through the spectacular landscapes of Bolivia, where he discovers evidence of a civilisation with a vast understanding of its environment, a religion based on collective effort, and a ritual of beer drinking

programme.title: Salamander
programme.desc: Gerardi is finally persuaded by Persigal to join the elite P9 agency with instructions to discover who is behind the break-in at the Jonkhere bank. The Salamander organisation suffers a blow with the suicide of the Minister of Interior, but they are soon lining up their forces behind Senator Guy Rasenberg to stand as his successor. Belgian thriller, starring Filip Peeters, Mike Verdrengh and Koen de Bouw. In Flemish and French

programme.title: Salamander
programme.desc: Paul discovers that a member of the Royal Family has been involved in a scandal which has been hushed up by Guy Rasenberg and the Salamander organisation. Belgian thriller, starring Filip Peeters, Mike Verdrengh and Koen de Bouw. In Flemish and French

programme.desc: A self-centred yuppie lawyer is horrified when a judge finds him guilty of drink-driving and orders him to coach a hopeless inner-city junior ice-hockey team as part of his community service. However, he comes to appreciate his new role and things finally start to look up for the team. Comedy, starring Emilio Estevez, Joss Ackland, Lane Smith and Joshua Jackson. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Brit Awards 2014
programme.desc: James Corden hosts the star-studded music ceremony live from London's O2, featuring performances by Arctic Monkeys, Bastille, Rudimental, Bruno Mars, Disclosure, Ellie Goulding, Lorde, Katy Perry and Pharrell Williams. Bastille and Disclosure lead the way with four nominations each, while David Bowie is in the running for British Male Solo Artist and the coveted Album of the Year, 30 years after winning his first Brit. Jessie J, Jake Bugg, James Blake, Daft Punk, Haim, Drake, Laura Mvula, Tom Odell, London Grammar, Janelle Monae and One Direction are among those also hoping to take home a prized statuette, while viewers have the chance to vote for the winner of this year's new category, Best British Video

programme.title: The Perfect Man (2005)
programme.desc: Teenager Holly Hamilton grows tired of moving home every time her mother splits up with another boyfriend. When the family travels to New York, Holly is determined to stay in one place and vows to find her mum the ideal partner - even if she has to make him up. However, when the relationship starts to take off, Holly is faced with the impossible task of producing a perfect man to live up to her mother's inflated expectations. Romantic comedy, starring Hilary Duff, Heather Locklear and Chris Noth. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven (2001)
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac. Including FYI Daily

programme.desc: A self-centred yuppie lawyer is horrified when a judge finds him guilty of drink-driving and orders him to coach a hopeless inner-city junior ice-hockey team as part of his community service. However, he comes to appreciate his new role and things finally start to look up for the team. Comedy, starring Emilio Estevez, Joss Ackland, Lane Smith and Joshua Jackson

programme.title: Brit Awards 2014
programme.desc: James Corden hosts the star-studded music ceremony live from London's O2, featuring performances by Arctic Monkeys, Bastille, Rudimental, Bruno Mars, Disclosure, Ellie Goulding, Lorde, Katy Perry and Pharrell Williams. Bastille and Disclosure lead the way with four nominations each, while David Bowie is in the running for British Male Solo Artist and the coveted Album of the Year, 30 years after winning his first Brit. Jessie J, Jake Bugg, James Blake, Daft Punk, Haim, Drake, Laura Mvula, Tom Odell, London Grammar, Janelle Monae and One Direction are among those also hoping to take home a prized statuette, while viewers have the chance to vote for the winner of this year's new category, Best British Video

programme.title: The Perfect Man (2005)
programme.desc: Teenager Holly Hamilton grows tired of moving home every time her mother splits up with another boyfriend. When the family travels to New York, Holly is determined to stay in one place and vows to find her mum the ideal partner - even if she has to make him up. However, when the relationship starts to take off, Holly is faced with the impossible task of producing a perfect man to live up to her mother's inflated expectations. Romantic comedy, starring Hilary Duff, Heather Locklear and Chris Noth

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven (2001)
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac

Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed.
