programme.desc: Bill asks Faith to celebrate moving in together by painting the town red, but she has other priorities to consider. Comedy, with James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George's jealousy rears its ugly head, but Mildred is in no hurry to put his mind at rest

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Hippies colonise Lawson's holiday cottages, causing much local dissent and tut-tutting. The only people who don't object to their presence are an undercover journalist in search of a scoop, and Vernon, who is not slow to spot a way of capitalising on the situation. Starring Geoffrey Hughes and Malcolm Tierney

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates whether a curse on a stolen Indian pendant could be responsible for the death of Seth's brother. Angela Lansbury stars

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When director Nick Cheyney is found beheaded by a guillotine on the set of his latest film, Barnaby and Jones are left with no shortage of suspects. The victim, it transpires, was on poor terms with several people in some way connected to the project, including the mother of his child, and an actor who blamed him for ruining his career. Guest starring Nicky Henson

programme.title: The Ice Cream Girls
programme.desc: With Poppy seeking revenge, Serena struggles to block out the memories from her past. As her mother's health deteriorates, she realises she must face the burden on her own, and resolves to report her former school friend to the probation services. Excluded and alone, Poppy remains determined to get the truth from Serena, and confides in lifeguard Al. Drama based on the novel by Dorothy Koomson, starring Lorraine Burroughs, Jodhi May, Martin Compston and Dona Croll

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When a 16-year-old girl is found dead in her home, Brooks and Devlin cannot be sure a crime was even committed. On further investigation, an unlikely murder weapon is uncovered and a suspect identified - a recently released serial rapist. Determined the accused is guilty, Steel pursues him with every power available - pushing the boundaries of the law to the limit. Crime drama, guest starring Kevin Doyle (Drop Dead Gorgeous), with Ben Daniels

programme.title: To Kill a Mockingbird (1962)
programme.desc: A lawyer risks the wrath of his neighbours in a racially divided backwater in Alabama by agreeing to defend a black man on a rape charge. As he struggles to shield his son and daughter from the case's disturbing undertones, the children also have to confront their fear of a local recluse. Oscar-winning, Depression-era drama based on the classic novel by Harper Lee, starring Gregory Peck, Robert Duvall, Mary Badham and Phillip Alford. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A houseguest wakes up in dilapidated Wisteria Lodge to find that his host and all the household servants have vanished. Understandably perplexed, he heads straight for Baker Street and asks Holmes to solve the mystery of their disappearance. Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas is just around the corner, but the last thing Aidensfield's residents feel like doing is over-indulging as a salmonella epidemic grips the village and Dr Summerbee struggles to maintain her goodwill. Meanwhile, Vernon decides the time is right to expand Bernie's funeral empire

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A piano teacher (guest star George Costigan) remains suspiciously secretive about his past when brought in to casualty after collapsing outside the hospital. Matron's revelation about Susie cools Alun's interest in her, and Mike takes pity on a mother while he treats her son. Elsewhere, Jill delivers bad news to an elderly patient and the porters are forced to take industrial action in support of a colleague

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth takes a break on the island of Rhodes, where an English beauty draws attention by flirting with fellow guests at the Palace Hotel. When she is found murdered, her husband is immediately suspected, but Poirot quickly deduces there is more to the case than a simple crime of passion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: William decides to complain to the mayor, after he and Nester are kept awake by the nocturnal activities of a local farmer. Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie star

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Bill falls ill, and is none too impressed with Faith's bedside manner. Comedy, with James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George's brother discovers documents that prove Mildred married an Army deserter. Comedy, starring Yootha Joyce and Brian Murphy

programme.title: Heartbeat

Meanwhile, Vernon decides the time is right to expand Bernie's funeral empire

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A famous, but ailing, playwright tempts fate by proposing to Jessica - and almost immediately finds himself charged with murdering his business manager. Rene Auberjonois (Star Trek: Deep Space Nine) guest stars

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective investigates after a botanist accidentally unearths the body of a recently buried professor who was fixated upon solving a seemingly impossible riddle by Lewis Carroll. The victim had a long-standing rivalry with his brother - giving Lewis and Hathaway an obvious suspect - but the case is hindered by the mind games of two students who seem intent on causing trouble in their quest to gain admittance to a mysterious club. Guest starring Celia Imrie and James Fleet, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: The Ice Cream Girls
programme.desc: Poppy finds herself back inside a cell after breaking the terms of her probation, while Serena's life also takes a turn for the worse when her identity as the second `ice-cream girl' is exposed to Evan. Devastated by his wife's betrayal, he leaves, taking Vee with him. With nothing left to lose, Serena decides it's time to confront the past once and for all as she visits her old friend in detention. Drama based on the novel by Dorothy Koomson, starring Jodhi May and Lorraine Burroughs. Last in the series

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Two children go on trial for killing a toddler, each blaming the other, and the case hinges on whether forensic evidence can prove who is guilty of strangling the boy to death. CPS director George Castle defies his superiors and takes instruction from the victim's mother, who has a surprising point of view on the crime. Drama, guest starring Deborah Findlay (Cranford), with Bill Paterson

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part two of two. Following the death of their prime suspect, Connor instructs her team to keep on top of the investigation. Details of Carlisle's private life begin to emerge, leading to suspicions the truth may lie in the familiar motive of adultery and revenge. However, the tragic death of Amber Webster could also have a part to play. Victoria Smurfit, David Hayman and Dorian Lough star

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in Aidensfield, and Mike and Tricia try to reunite a blind woman with her stolen guide dog. Elsewhere, a young woman at the centre of a political scandal seeks refuge in Aidensfield as she attempts to avoid the paparazzi. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A train crash claims the life of an infant making Jill more determined than ever to support Carnegie's plans for a premature baby unit at the hospital. Meanwhile, local farmer Sam Benson (guest star Jack Deam) causes concern with his erratic behaviour, and Stella's rapist requires life-saving surgery after being attacked by the father of another victim

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: A prestigious French magazine selects William and Hestor as the main subjects of a feature about the increasing number of English people moving to France. Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers star

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Bill spots a few flaws in family life when Faith expects him to get tough in his role as stepfather. Comedy, starring James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George buy a pair of homing pigeons with which to annoy his next door neighbours, after Mildred accidentally flushes his beloved goldfish down the sink. Brian Murphy stars

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas arrives in Aidensfield, and Mike and Tricia try to reunite a blind woman with her stolen guide dog. Elsewhere, a young woman at the centre of a political scandal seeks refuge in Aidensfield as she attempts to avoid the paparazzi. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A priest and government agents using a safe house get Jessica involved in a complicated case, in which she hears the confession of a dying assassin who is connected to a recent murder. Angela Lansbury stars

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A barmaid's murder leads Lewis (Kevin Whately) and Hathaway (Laurence Fox) to a respected professor, who admits he once had an affair with the woman. However, they discover the killing was copied straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by an Oxford tutor, suggesting it may be the work of a crazed fan - or something even more sinister. Guest starring Art Malik, Tom Mison and James Fox, father of Laurence

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Two successful career women are found raped and strangled in imitation of similar murders years earlier in continental Europe. Tony picks up the links with Bradfield's own business community, but his investigations are interrupted by the unexpected arrival of teenage killer Jack Norton, who is on the run from his social workers because he cannot cope with life `released under licence'

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When police sergeant Pete Garvey is killed, the investigation proves harrowing for Devlin as he was one of his best friends. The detective discovers the officer had recently been in contact with their childhood parish priest Jonathan Nugent, who Pete claimed sexually abused him as a child. Unable to place a straightforward murder charge against Nugent, Steel and Phillips take an unusual approach to bring him to trial. Guest starring Matthew Marsh, Ruth Gemmell and Patrick Malahide, with Jamie Bamber

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Crusty senior diplomat Mycroft Holmes enlists the help of his more famous younger brother Sherlock to recover missing submarine plans vital to national security. Guest starring Charles Gray. Last in the series

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The Baker Street sleuth is summoned to the Lake District to investigate the mysterious disappearance of an enigmatic woman. Period detective drama, guest starring Michael Jayston and Cheryl Campbell with Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill becomes unwell after receiving the results of a pregnancy test. Elsewhere, when a baby goes missing, suspicion falls on the parents of a girl admitted with a broken ankle. Meanwhile, Gordon makes a discovery about a diabetic patient that explains his behaviour and, in a dramatic finale, tragedy looms. Daniel Casey guest stars

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: Hester wins a raffle at the village fair - but is less than enamoured by her prize. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Bill and Faith prepare to get married, but Hannah and Joe do not share the growing excitement as their mother's big day approaches. Comedy, with James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: A valuable heirloom brought back from the China Sea could change the Ropers' fortunes - but not if Mildred's sister gets it first. Starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Cabot Cove becomes the scene of deadly competition when an eccentric recluse dies, and Jessica is given the dubious honour of executing the woman's will. Starring Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Caroline Quentin's National Parks
programme.desc: The actress presents a documentary exploring the natural beauty of three of Britain's most popular national parks, beginning with Loch Lomond and the Trossachs in the south-west of Scotland. At Inveraray Castle on the outskirts of the park, she enjoys the annual Highland Games event, before spending the night with a group of volunteers monitoring bats on one of the loch's most picturesque islands, Inchcailloch. She also finds time to help tag a roost of owl chicks and take a dip in the icy cold water with a wild-swimming enthusiast

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones resume their partnership as the northern-based crime drama returns. In the first of a two-part story, the badly burned body of a disabled man turns up in a remote part of Manchester and a few days later another corpse is discovered. The detectives start to realise the victims were not just murdered, but tortured too. They make an arrest, but it becomes clear their investigation has just scratched the surface. Meanwhile, Janet throws her husband out and Rachel's estranged brother turns up on her doorstep. With Lisa Riley and Pippa Haywood

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of prison officer Charlie Tyner, Brooks and Devlin discover he had been abusing his position and convicts in his charge. A suspect is brought to trial, but Steel and Phillips go in pursuit of a career criminal connected to Tyner and have to persuade their key witness to give evidence against a man she claims to love. Starring Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman

programme.title: Gregory's Girl (1981)
programme.desc: A gawky teenager is dismayed to be relegated to goalkeeper in the school football team - but his thoughts turn to romance once he meets the female striker who takes his place. However, his awkward nature proves an obstacle to winning her over, despite the sage advice of his worldly-wise little sister. Comedy, starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Jake D'Arcy, Clare Grogan and Robert Buchanan. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: George and Mildred

programme.desc: Tommy attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice when a man is found dead on a golf course. Drama, starring Francesca Annis and James Warwick

programme.title: The Three Musketeers (1973) (?)
programme.desc: No details

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Mischievous artist Harry Field, who specialises in preparing bogus coats of arms for gullible American tourists, is murdered - and Morse takes a personal interest in finding the culprit. But as investigations progress, he discovers the victim was not quite the lovable rogue he initially appeared. John Thaw stars, with Kevin Whately, Geraldine James and Freddie Jones

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The death of Oxford don RG Cole leads to the shady underworld of unlicensed boxing and the involvement of academic Richard Helm. Investigations reveal the dead man's student Jack Roth was involved in a complex love triangle, and when the young man's rival is found dead in an apparent suicide, Lewis suspects foul play and discovers an old connection to Helm - along with a link to his former mentor Morse. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster meets fellow enthusiasts Tommy and Tuppence at a nursing home, where the ramblings of an elderly resident prompt them to join forces and investigate the unsolved mystery of a murdered child. The trail leads to the Norfolk village of Farrell St Edmund, a community harbouring sinister secrets and tales of heartbreak. Geraldine McEwan heads an all-star cast, including Greta Scacchi, Anthony Andrews, Charles Dance, June Whitfield and Claire Bloom

programme.title: Clockwise (1986)
programme.desc: A headmaster obsessed with punctuality catches the wrong train en route to a convention where he is due to make an important speech, turning the entire journey into a frantic race against the clock. Comedy, starring John Cleese, Alison Steadman, Stephen Moore, Penelope Wilton and Joan Hickson. Including FYI Daily

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: News of Martin and Louisa's engagement spreads rapidly through the village, and Aunt Joan is annoyed to hear about it from Dave rather than her nephew. Al steps in to help as Bert struggles to keep the restaurant afloat, while the doctor is puzzled when he learns Beth's knee replacement wound is failing to respond to the medication he prescribed. Comedy drama series, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Part one of two. The team finds links between a 10-year-old murder and the discovery of a body in the local reservoir, prompting the irascible inspector to seek out one of the most ruthless and driven killers he has ever encountered. Starring David Jason, Bruce Alexander and Susan Penhaligon

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: William suffers his first brush with French law enforcers after Hester invites his new boss over for dinner. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A prodigal son returns to claim his inheritance, setting off alarm bells for Ventress, whose instinct is confirmed when a series of accidents at the carpet factory signals the management's scant regard for life and limb. Meanwhile, Vernon Scripps spies an opportunity to make merry as well as money by organising a beauty pageant - but reckons without the determined opposition of disapproving Joyce Jowett, who will stop at nothing to halt the event

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Mr Middleditch makes a surprise return to the hospital in the back of an ambulance, having hurt his ankle while fishing. Stella grudgingly welcomes Marian McKaig as her room-mate, but the new nurse quickly catches Alun's eye. Meanwhile, a frantic mother calls for Mike's help at a hippie commune, where her hostile husband is refusing help from the outside world. Ian Carmichael rejoins the series, which continues from earlier in the year. With Ted Robbins

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective begins to suspect something is amiss when he visits one of his favoured haunts in London for dinner and discovers a fellow regular has dramatically changed his diet. Down in Brighton, elderly Anthony Gascoigne lies dying while his estranged twin brother Henry falls to his death - but nobody is sure whether the man was deliberately pushed. Bizarrely, the key to the riddle seems to lie in a blackberry pie. David Suchet stars in the title role, with Philip Jackson, Hugh Fraser and Pauline Moran

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George's jealousy rears its ugly head, but Mildred is in no hurry to put his mind at rest

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Hippies colonise Lawson's holiday cottages, causing much local dissent and tut-tutting. The only people who don't object to their presence are an undercover journalist in search of a scoop, and Vernon, who is not slow to spot a way of capitalising on the situation. Starring Geoffrey Hughes and Malcolm Tierney

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Jessica investigates whether a curse on a stolen Indian pendant could be responsible for the death of Seth's brother. Angela Lansbury stars

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When director Nick Cheyney is found beheaded by a guillotine on the set of his latest film, Barnaby and Jones are left with no shortage of suspects. The victim, it transpires, was on poor terms with several people in some way connected to the project, including the mother of his child, and an actor who blamed him for ruining his career. Guest starring Nicky Henson

programme.title: The Ice Cream Girls
programme.desc: With Poppy seeking revenge, Serena struggles to block out the memories from her past. As her mother's health deteriorates, she realises she must face the burden on her own, and resolves to report her former school friend to the probation services. Excluded and alone, Poppy remains determined to get the truth from Serena, and confides in lifeguard Al. Drama based on the novel by Dorothy Koomson, starring Lorraine Burroughs, Jodhi May, Martin Compston and Dona Croll

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When a 16-year-old girl is found dead in her home, Brooks and Devlin cannot be sure a crime was even committed. On further investigation, an unlikely murder weapon is uncovered and a suspect identified - a recently released serial rapist. Determined the accused is guilty, Steel pursues him with every power available - pushing the boundaries of the law to the limit. Crime drama, guest starring Kevin Doyle (Drop Dead Gorgeous), with Ben Daniels

programme.title: To Kill a Mockingbird (1962)
programme.desc: A lawyer risks the wrath of his neighbours in a racially divided backwater in Alabama by agreeing to defend a black man on a rape charge. As he struggles to shield his son and daughter from the case's disturbing undertones, the children also have to confront their fear of a local recluse. Oscar-winning, Depression-era drama based on the classic novel by Harper Lee, starring Gregory Peck, Robert Duvall, Mary Badham and Phillip Alford

programme.desc: Emma and her husband arrive for a short break - but William and Nester find the experience of putting them up exhausing. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A patient is admitted with a fever and a swollen arm covered in black lesions, but Mike is nowhere to be seen. Blood tests confirm a case of anthrax, prompting an investigation by the Public Health Officer. Elsewhere, a specialist is summoned when a woman's dizzy spells cause concern, while Alun and Lizzie are intrigued by the mysterious appearance of a young woman

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: After enjoying a trip to the theatre with Captain Hastings, the detective is disturbed by the sound of gunshots in an apartment at Whitehaven Mansions, and soon finds himself investigating a murder. Drama, starring David Suchet, Hugh Fraser and Philip Jackson

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A houseguest wakes up in dilapidated Wisteria Lodge to find that his host and all the household servants have vanished. Understandably perplexed, he heads straight for Baker Street and asks Holmes to solve the mystery of their disappearance. Jeremy Brett and Edward Hardwicke star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas is just around the corner, but the last thing Aidensfield's residents feel like doing is over-indulging as a salmonella epidemic grips the village and Dr Summerbee struggles to maintain her goodwill. Meanwhile, Vernon decides the time is right to expand Bernie's funeral empire

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A piano teacher (guest star George Costigan) remains suspiciously secretive about his past when brought in to casualty after collapsing outside the hospital. Matron's revelation about Susie cools Alun's interest in her, and Mike takes pity on a mother while he treats her son. Elsewhere, Jill delivers bad news to an elderly patient and the porters are forced to take industrial action in support of a colleague

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian sleuth takes a break on the island of Rhodes, where an English beauty draws attention by flirting with fellow guests at the Palace Hotel. When she is found murdered, her husband is immediately suspected, but Poirot quickly deduces there is more to the case than a simple crime of passion. Whodunit, starring David Suchet

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: William decides to complain to the mayor, after he and Nester are kept awake by the nocturnal activities of a local farmer. Anton Rodgers and Julia McKenzie star

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Bill falls ill, and is none too impressed with Faith's bedside manner. Comedy, with James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George's brother discovers documents that prove Mildred married an Army deserter. Comedy, starring Yootha Joyce and Brian Murphy

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Christmas is just around the corner, but the last thing Aidensfield's residents feel like doing is over-indulging as a salmonella epidemic grips the village and Dr Summerbee struggles to maintain her goodwill. Meanwhile, Vernon decides the time is right to expand Bernie's funeral empire

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A famous, but ailing, playwright tempts fate by proposing to Jessica - and almost immediately finds himself charged with murdering his business manager. Rene Auberjonois (Star Trek: Deep Space Nine) guest stars

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The detective investigates after a botanist accidentally unearths the body of a recently buried professor who was fixated upon solving a seemingly impossible riddle by Lewis Carroll. The victim had a long-standing rivalry with his brother - giving Lewis and Hathaway an obvious suspect - but the case is hindered by the mind games of two students who seem intent on causing trouble in their quest to gain admittance to a mysterious club. Guest starring Celia Imrie and James Fleet, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: The Ice Cream Girls
programme.desc: Poppy finds herself back inside a cell after breaking the terms of her probation, while Serena's life also takes a turn for the worse when her identity as the second `ice-cream girl' is exposed to Evan. Devastated by his wife's betrayal, he leaves, taking Vee with him. With nothing left to lose, Serena decides it's time to confront the past once and for all as she visits her old friend in detention. Drama based on the novel by Dorothy Koomson, starring Jodhi May and Lorraine Burroughs. Last in the series

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Two children go on trial for killing a toddler, each blaming the other, and the case hinges on whether forensic evidence can prove who is guilty of strangling the boy to death. CPS director George Castle defies his superiors and takes instruction from the victim's mother, who has a surprising point of view on the crime. Drama, guest starring Deborah Findlay (Cranford), with Bill Paterson

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part two of two. Following the death of their prime suspect, Connor instructs her team to keep on top of the investigation. Details of Carlisle's private life begin to emerge, leading to suspicions the truth may lie in the familiar motive of adultery and revenge. However, the tragic death of Amber Webster could also have a part to play. Victoria Smurfit, David Hayman and Dorian Lough star

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes

programme.desc: Christmas arrives in Aidensfield, and Mike and Tricia try to reunite a blind woman with her stolen guide dog. Elsewhere, a young woman at the centre of a political scandal seeks refuge in Aidensfield as she attempts to avoid the paparazzi. Jason Durr and Clare Calbraith star

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A train crash claims the life of an infant making Jill more determined than ever to support Carnegie's plans for a premature baby unit at the hospital. Meanwhile, local farmer Sam Benson (guest star Jack Deam) causes concern with his erratic behaviour, and Stella's rapist requires life-saving surgery after being attacked by the father of another victim

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective's curiosity is aroused by the passengers on board a luxury cruise ship bound for Egypt - particularly a woman who appears inordinately offensive to her fellow travellers. When the vessel arrives at Alexandria, the irritating lady's body is discovered in her cabin - leaving the sleuth with a host of possible suspects to interrogate. David Suchet stars

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: A prestigious French magazine selects William and Hestor as the main subjects of a feature about the increasing number of English people moving to France. Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers star

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Bill spots a few flaws in family life when Faith expects him to get tough in his role as stepfather. Comedy, starring James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: George buy a pair of homing pigeons with which to annoy his next door neighbours, after Mildred accidentally flushes his beloved goldfish down the sink. Brian Murphy stars

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: A priest and government agents using a safe house get Jessica involved in a complicated case, in which she hears the confession of a dying assassin who is connected to a recent murder. Angela Lansbury stars

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A barmaid's murder leads Lewis (Kevin Whately) and Hathaway (Laurence Fox) to a respected professor, who admits he once had an affair with the woman. However, they discover the killing was copied straight from the pages of a popular fantasy novel written by an Oxford tutor, suggesting it may be the work of a crazed fan - or something even more sinister. Guest starring Art Malik, Tom Mison and James Fox, father of Laurence

programme.title: Wire in the Blood
programme.desc: Two successful career women are found raped and strangled in imitation of similar murders years earlier in continental Europe. Tony picks up the links with Bradfield's own business community, but his investigations are interrupted by the unexpected arrival of teenage killer Jack Norton, who is on the run from his social workers because he cannot cope with life `released under licence'

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: When police sergeant Pete Garvey is killed, the investigation proves harrowing for Devlin as he was one of his best friends. The detective discovers the officer had recently been in contact with their childhood parish priest Jonathan Nugent, who Pete claimed sexually abused him as a child. Unable to place a straightforward murder charge against Nugent, Steel and Phillips take an unusual approach to bring him to trial. Guest starring Matthew Marsh, Ruth Gemmell and Patrick Malahide, with Jamie Bamber

programme.title: The Return of Sherlock Holmes

programme.title: The Casebook of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: The Baker Street sleuth is summoned to the Lake District to investigate the mysterious disappearance of an enigmatic woman. Period detective drama, guest starring Michael Jayston and Cheryl Campbell with Jeremy Brett

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Suspicion falls on Adam over missing hospital funds and Mike attends a meeting to assess the mental welfare of a 50-year-old man (guest Andrew Dunn) who still lives with his mother. Elsewhere, Gordon's former father-in-law pays an unexpected visit with sobering news and Ken makes a confession to his colleagues. Guest starring Michael Jayston

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Jill becomes unwell after receiving the results of a pregnancy test. Elsewhere, when a baby goes missing, suspicion falls on the parents of a girl admitted with a broken ankle. Meanwhile, Gordon makes a discovery about a diabetic patient that explains his behaviour and, in a dramatic finale, tragedy looms. Daniel Casey guest stars

programme.title: French Fields
programme.desc: Hester wins a raffle at the village fair - but is less than enamoured by her prize. Comedy, starring Julia McKenzie and Anton Rodgers

programme.title: Second Thoughts
programme.desc: Bill and Faith prepare to get married, but Hannah and Joe do not share the growing excitement as their mother's big day approaches. Comedy, with James Bolam, Lynda Bellingham and Belinda Lang

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: A valuable heirloom brought back from the China Sea could change the Ropers' fortunes - but not if Mildred's sister gets it first. Starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Blaketon is overjoyed when he discovers a cricketing legend has checked into the pub. David inadvertently prompts a petrol crisis. Nostalgic drama, starring Derek Fowlds, David Lonsdale and Clive Mantle

programme.title: Murder, She Wrote
programme.desc: Cabot Cove becomes the scene of deadly competition when an eccentric recluse dies, and Jessica is given the dubious honour of executing the woman's will. Starring Angela Lansbury

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Caroline Quentin's National Parks
programme.desc: The actress presents a documentary exploring the natural beauty of three of Britain's most popular national parks, beginning with Loch Lomond and the Trossachs in the south-west of Scotland. At Inveraray Castle on the outskirts of the park, she enjoys the annual Highland Games event, before spending the night with a group of volunteers monitoring bats on one of the loch's most picturesque islands, Inchcailloch. She also finds time to help tag a roost of owl chicks and take a dip in the icy cold water with a wild-swimming enthusiast

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones resume their partnership as the northern-based crime drama returns. In the first of a two-part story, the badly burned body of a disabled man turns up in a remote part of Manchester and a few days later another corpse is discovered. The detectives start to realise the victims were not just murdered, but tortured too. They make an arrest, but it becomes clear their investigation has just scratched the surface. Meanwhile, Janet throws her husband out and Rachel's estranged brother turns up on her doorstep. With Lisa Riley and Pippa Haywood

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: While investigating the murder of prison officer Charlie Tyner, Brooks and Devlin discover he had been abusing his position and convicts in his charge. A suspect is brought to trial, but Steel and Phillips go in pursuit of a career criminal connected to Tyner and have to persuade their key witness to give evidence against a man she claims to love. Starring Bradley Walsh, Jamie Bamber, Ben Daniels and Freema Agyeman

programme.title: Gregory's Girl (1981)
programme.desc: A gawky teenager is dismayed to be relegated to goalkeeper in the school football team - but his thoughts turn to romance once he meets the female striker who takes his place. However, his awkward nature proves an obstacle to winning her over, despite the sage advice of his worldly-wise little sister. Comedy, starring John Gordon Sinclair, Dee Hepburn, Jake D'Arcy, Clare Grogan and Robert Buchanan

programme.title: George and Mildred
programme.desc: A valuable heirloom brought back from the China Sea could change the Ropers' fortunes - but not if Mildred's sister gets it first. Starring Brian Murphy and Yootha Joyce

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Partners in Crime
programme.desc: Tommy attempts to prevent a miscarriage of justice when a man is found dead on a golf course. Drama, starring Francesca Annis and James Warwick

programme.title: The Three Musketeers (1973) (?)
programme.desc: No details

programme.title: Inspector Morse
programme.desc: Mischievous artist Harry Field, who specialises in preparing bogus coats of arms for gullible American tourists, is murdered - and Morse takes a personal interest in finding the culprit. But as investigations progress, he discovers the victim was not quite the lovable rogue he initially appeared. John Thaw stars, with Kevin Whately, Geraldine James and Freddie Jones

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: The death of Oxford don RG Cole leads to the shady underworld of unlicensed boxing and the involvement of academic Richard Helm. Investigations reveal the dead man's student Jack Roth was involved in a complex love triangle, and when the young man's rival is found dead in an apparent suicide, Lewis suspects foul play and discovers an old connection to Helm - along with a link to his former mentor Morse. Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
programme.desc: The sleuthing spinster meets fellow enthusiasts Tommy and Tuppence at a nursing home, where the ramblings of an elderly resident prompt them to join forces and investigate the unsolved mystery of a murdered child. The trail leads to the Norfolk village of Farrell St Edmund, a community harbouring sinister secrets and tales of heartbreak. Geraldine McEwan heads an all-star cast, including Greta Scacchi, Anthony Andrews, Charles Dance, June Whitfield and Claire Bloom

programme.title: Clockwise (1986)
programme.desc: A headmaster obsessed with punctuality catches the wrong train en route to a convention where he is due to make an important speech, turning the entire journey into a frantic race against the clock. Comedy, starring John Cleese, Alison Steadman, Stephen Moore, Penelope Wilton and Joan Hickson

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The Belgian detective is summoned to a hotel by a mysterious veiled lady who tells him that her forthcoming marriage is under threat because she is being blackmailed over a love letter. Drama, starring David Suchet and Frances Barber

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Rosemary and Laura are employed to restore a country churchyard in time for a medieval fair, but it is not long before a local landowner is killed by an arrow beneath an ancient yew in the centre of the graveyard. The duo investigate the possibility that rival bidders for the victim's highly desirable farm are to blame - though affairs of the heart might offer a more likely motive. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: News of Martin and Louisa's engagement spreads rapidly through the village, and Aunt Joan is annoyed to hear about it from Dave rather than her nephew. Al steps in to help as Bert struggles to keep the restaurant afloat, while the doctor is puzzled when he learns Beth's knee replacement wound is failing to respond to the medication he prescribed. Comedy drama series, starring Martin Clunes

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter

programme.title: Police, Camera, Action!
programme.desc: A look at the most lethal and careless drivers on the road, responsible for the deaths of hundreds of victims each year. Alastair Stewart and Adrian Simpson follow the journey of a death wish driver and discover the tragic consequences of being reckless on the road. Including dramatic police footage of kamikaze crooks at the wheel

programme.title: World's Wildest Police Videos
programme.desc: Real-life crimes captured by cameras inside patrol cars and police helicopters. Hosted by former US sheriff John Bunnell

programme.title: Whisker Wars
programme.desc: The beard circuit heads for Texas, where Jack Passion must face the Austin boys on their home turf following their earlier confrontation, while Myk O'Connor also has a score to settle

programme.title: Whisker Wars
programme.desc: The Beardsmen head to Philadelphia to compete in the East Coast Beard and Moustache championships, the final American stop on the annual circuit

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Rebecca dreams of a romantic day with Robin, but he has other plans - competing with Sam in a series of offbeat challenges. Comedy, starring Ted Danson and Kirstie Alley

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Carla contests Eddie's will, and goes head to head with his other wife, who's discovered the estate is worth a small fortune. Comedy, with Ted Danson and Rhea Perlman

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: Theo persuades a witness to testify in court, and is then faced with the task of protecting her from attack

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Part one. The private eye encounters a face from the past in the shape of a vengeful Russian colonel who he first met during the Vietnam war. Drama, starring Tom Selleck

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Badgered by Ray over his methods of running the firm and seduced by a contemporary business rival about the virtues of retirement, Arthur decides to hand across Daley Enterprises to his nephew. However, in the event neither finds the move easy to handle. Liz Fraser guest stars, alongside George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: CI5 investigates a judge's death and finds a connection with a deadly terrorist group of young middle-class drop-outs that has declared war on the legal system. On catching one of its number, Bodie and Doyle learn of a bomb due to explode in a courthouse. Drama, starring Martin Shaw and Lewis Collins. Last in the series

programme.title: Whisker Wars
programme.desc: Former world champion Jack Passion, who suffered a string of defeats on the US circuit, heads to Germany to reclaim his reputation via the International Beard and Moustache championships. Last in the series

programme.title: Police, Camera, Action!
programme.desc: Alastair Stewart and Adrian Simpson put the spotlight on drivers who endanger the environment and other road users with their disregard for safe practices

programme.title: World's Wildest Police Videos
programme.desc: Real-life crimes captured by cameras inside patrol cars and police helicopters. Hosted by former US sheriff John Bunnell

programme.title: Kojak
programme.desc: A small-time crook is arrested in connection with a shooting, and refuses to co-operate when Theo tries to clear him

programme.title: Magnum, PI
programme.desc: Part two of two. The detectives fear for their lives when an old army friend reveals that a Russian agent who tortured them in Vietnam is determined to finish the job

programme.title: Minder
programme.desc: Badgered by Ray over his methods of running the firm and seduced by a contemporary business rival about the virtues of retirement, Arthur decides to hand across Daley Enterprises to his nephew. However, in the event neither finds the move easy to handle. Liz Fraser guest stars, alongside George Cole and Gary Webster

programme.title: The Professionals
programme.desc: Cowley and the team are confused by a chain of events that involves lethal narcotics, a series of killings and a drug addict. As they piece the clues together, Bodie and Doyle realise someone has a plan to flood the public water supply with lethal hallucenogenic drugs. Drama, starring Martin Shaw, Lewis Collins and Gordon Jackson

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: The bar's annual St Patrick's Day rivalry with Gary's Tavern heats up with the disappearance of the Cheers lucky mascot. Comedy, starring Ted Danson

programme.title: Cheers
programme.desc: Woody mulls over Kelly's impending return to Europe and ends up asking Sam for advice on how to elope with her. Bar-room comedy, starring Ted Danson and Woody Harrelson

Plus, a look at the conception of twins and how it often entails a struggle for survival

programme.title: Police Interceptors
programme.desc: Officers from Lincolnshire's Roads Policing Unit are at the forefront of a raid against suspected drug traffickers, the hunt is on for a driver who has fled the scene of a horrific crash, and Rich Precious and Sean Baxter are left lagging far behind as they chase a speeding biker. Dan Brigginshaw is on duty at Spalding's annual flower show, and Sean Brennan deals with a young man who thinks he can throw his weight around after a boozy night out

programme.title: Elektra (2005)
programme.desc: A martial arts expert returns from the dead and becomes an infamous assassin. Hired to kill a man and his daughter, she finds the mission weighing heavily on her conscience and chooses instead to save their lives from a secret ninja society with mystical powers. Comic-book adventure, with Jennifer Garner, Goran Visnjic, Kirsten Prout and Terence Stamp

programme.title: Biggest Boozers 2
programme.desc: A countdown of some of the most outrageous alcohol-related incidents ever caught on film. Including a girl who gets stuck in a clothes dryer, a scorpion chaser and a set of siblings who have an unusual visit to the dentist

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Home and Away
programme.desc: Sun-kissed Australian soap charting the latest comings and goings of the Summer Bay regulars

programme.title: Space Jam (1996)
programme.desc: Aliens arrive on Earth to abduct the Looney Tunes gang as a new attraction at their failing intergalactic theme park. To keep their freedom, Bugs Bunny and friends challenge the invaders to a high-stakes basketball game, calling on Michael Jordan to save the day and send the extraterrestrials back where they came from. Live action and animated comedy, starring Bill Murray and Danny DeVito, with the voices of Billy West and Bill Farmer

programme.title: American Idol
programme.desc: The hopefuls who received a golden ticket arrive in California for the next round of the competition. However, in a new twist to the show, some of the acts are immediately singled out and must defend their places in the contest or risk being sent back home. Presented by Ryan Seacrest

programme.title: 5* Access
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes news and gossip from the world of showbiz

programme.title: Lost in Space (1998)
programme.desc: A pioneering scientist takes his family out into space to colonise another planet. However, a saboteur has infiltrated their craft, and his meddling leaves them stranded in unknown territory on the other side of the galaxy. Sci-fi adventure based on the 1960s TV show, starring William Hurt, Matt LeBlanc, Gary Oldman, Mimi Rogers and Heather Graham

programme.title: Falling Skies
programme.desc: Part two of two. The members of 2nd Massachusetts sent to accompany Clayton to his safe retreat begin to realise the extent of his plans for them, leading to an explosive confrontation with a faction of Skitter-aligned humans

programme.title: Brainless Blunders 1
programme.desc: A compilation of mishaps and mistakes captured on camera, including a snowmobile race that goes awry. A reporter gets covered in dirt, and construction foremen and office workers discover how on-the-job errors can have embarrassing and expensive consequences

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The spy locates the scientist who created the Intersect database implanted in his mind, while tension mounts between the Buy More crew and their Beverly Hills counterparts

programme.title: The Cradle Will Fall (2004)
programme.desc: A tenacious lawyer sets out to expose a devious gynaecologist who claims he can help infertile women become pregnant, convinced he is guilty of murder - but she is placed in peril by her investigation. Mystery, adapted from a novel by Mary Higgins Clark, starring Angie Everhart, John Ralston and Philippe Brenninkmeyer

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Horatio investigates the murder of a woman working for a dating agency, and although suspicion initially falls on an angry client, DNA testing reveals the killer was female. Valera later finds evidence that could solve the case - but unfortunately it would also violate the privacy of a rape victim. Elsewhere, Delko loses his badge and sets out to find it before it falls into the wrong hands

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Horatio and the team discover a woman's body in a secret tunnel leading to a bank vault and begin checking into her background. DNA evidence leads them to a man employed at a nearby building site, but subsequent developments implicate a millionaire's wayward daughter - and a bogus art dealer with links to the drug trade. Starring David Caruso and Adam Rodriguez

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Jesse and Dr Sloan are infected with a virus and face imminent death unless Steve and Amanda can find a cure. Crime drama, starring Dick and Barry Van Dyke, with Victoria Rowell, Charlie Schlatter and Michael Tucci

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the murder of a luxury sports car dealer and identify a link between the victim's last customer and a recent spate of robberies. However, the discovery that their prime suspect has learning difficulties soon leads the team to his manipulative girlfriend. Detective drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Flack looks into the death of a paintballer who was seemingly murdered when his killer swapped harmless ammunition for real bullets. The prime suspect turns out to be a rival who was competing with the victim for a sponsorship deal, but finding him is no easy matter. Meanwhile, Stella tells Mac she thinks she is being stalked. Forensic drama, starring Gary Sinise, Eddie Cahill and Melina Kanakaredes

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac and Danny raise questions over the murder of a US Marine corporal found stabbed to death in Central Park. A case of mistaken identity arises as Stella, Lindsay and Dr Hawkes investigate a body in a burnt-out car, and Sheldon makes a surprising discovery after creating a facial reconstruction from the skull. With Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Carmine Giovinazzo

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: Walt investigates when a rodeo sponsor is assaulted in his own home and left in a coma. The only clue is the theft of a seemingly worthless painting

programme.title: Magnum Force (1973)
programme.desc: Maverick cop Dirty Harry Callahan antagonises his superiors once more in his pursuit of a vigilante group responsible for murdering the city's most wanted criminals. However, he is unaware that the killers are some of his fellow officers - and are prepared to see him dead to keep their secret safe. Action thriller sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Hal Holbrook, Mitchell Ryan, David Soul and Robert Urich

programme.title: Terminator
programme.desc: As Cromartie stalks his prey, he is joined by an assistant in the form of teenage tearaway Jody, who met Cameron while in jail

programme.title: Alphas
programme.desc: The team encounters a high-school student with the devastating ability to control minds, and concerns are raised about the impact the boy's power has on those under his thrall. With the stakes higher than ever, Rosen is forced to join up with Stanton Parish to bring the teenager in for tests, unaware that his arch enemy has an ulterior motive for lending a hand. Sci-fi thriller, guest starring John Pyper-Ferguson and Connor Price

programme.title: My Name Is Earl
programme.desc: Joy plots to kill Earl so she can inherit his wealth. Unaware of her murderous intentions, he continues to atone for his misdeeds, visiting a man imprisoned for a crime the do-gooder committed, and making up for all the second-hand smoke he has inflicted on the world over the years

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: An agent is sent to evaluate Sarah's performance, but her complicated relationship with Chuck puts her job in jeopardy. Tricia Helfer guest stars

programme.title: By Appointment Only (2007)
programme.desc: A recently widowed single mother embarks on a career in real estate, and is drawn into a mysterious situation when the owner of a multi-million dollar house she is trying to sell suddenly disappears. Her investigations lead to a man claiming to be the missing client's nephew, who has deadly plans in mind. Thriller, starring Ally Walker, Currie Graham, Marnette Patterson and Jordan Garrett

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: An American football star is murdered at a school reunion, and it soon turns out there were plenty of jealous former classmates who would have been more than happy to see the back of him. Forensic crime drama, starring David Caruso, Emily Procter and Adam Rodriguez

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Stella and Lindsay investigate the rape and murder of a hostess. Meanwhile, the life of a transplant patient hangs in the balance as Mac and the rest of the team try to find a hijacked helicopter carrying a donor liver. With Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes, Anna Belknap and Carmine Giovinazzo

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Mark and Amanda join Steve in a bid to prove an ambitious figure skater hired her former coach to murder a professional rival. Mystery, starring Dick Van Dyke

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: New York's district attorneys investigate the mysterious death of a stockbroker who was dating the daughter of a ruthless cosmetics mogul - and find themselves caught up in a wrangle over whether HRT withdrawal can be used as a defence in law. Police drama, guest starring Lucie Arnaz, with Jerry Orbach and Sam Waterston

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A teenager who was recovering from a car accident becomes the apparent victim of a mercy killing, forcing Hawkes to make an emotional return to the hospital where he used to work - and reminding him why he changed his career path from surgery to criminal investigation. Forensic drama, starring Hill Harper

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Horatio and Delko head to Rio de Janeiro to find Marisol's killer, Antonio Riaz. Back in Miami, Ryan reluctantly works with new CSI Natalia Boa Vista on an investigation into the murder of a woman found dead in her own home. David Caruso and Adam Rodriguez star

programme.title: Person of Interest
programme.desc: The Machine directs Reese and Finch toward Dr Madeleine Enright, who is due to perform an operation on energy company CEO Oliver Veldt in complete secrecy. The surgeon is visited by Alistair Wesley, who tells her if she does not make an error during the procedure that leads to Veldt's death then her girlfriend will be killed. Guest starring Julian Sands

programme.title: Shoot 'Em Up (2007)
programme.desc: A gun-toting mysterious stranger delivers a baby, which he is forced to protect from a horde of heavily armed assassins. Enlisting the aid of a prostitute, he sets out to discover why the child has been marked for death - and if he cannot manage that, he will just kill everyone who gets in his way. Action adventure, starring Clive Owen, Paul Giamatti and Monica Bellucci

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team joins forces with military investigators to ascertain whether terrorists were responsible for an explosion at a golf course in which a marine colonel was killed. As inquiries proceed, McGee has to use his computer skills to break into secret government files if the murderers are to be apprehended. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon

programme.title: Steven Seagal
programme.desc: The actor searches for a man wanted for a double-shooting, and witnesses a crash when an out-of-control car heads into oncoming traffic

programme.title: Justified
programme.desc: Bail-jumper Jody Adair is finally caught, but manages to escape after the van he is being transported in gets a puncture and Kenneth, a seemingly Good Samaritan, stops to help. Two dead bodies later, the ensuing investigation reveals a connection between Jody and Kenneth, but when Raylan visits the house of the fugitive's ex-wife, little more than a flirty babysitter is found. Meanwhile, Boyd and Ava attend a swingers party in their search for more information about Drew Thompson

programme.title: Dark Blue
programme.desc: Carter and Alex pose as high-stakes drug tourists in an attempt to trap gang members who have been masquerading as DEA agents. Dean and Ty try to win the trust of a well-connected karaoke king and Jaimie convinces the gang's leader - but there are concerns over her state of mind after she loses control of a suspect

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The reluctant secret agent tracks down his long-lost father and gets a job working with one of his idols, business magnate Ted Roark. Meanwhile, Lester and Jeff convince Mike they should attend NextExpo. Chevy Chase and Scott Bakula guest star

programme.title: The Long Shot (2004)
programme.desc: A woman's plans for a new life with her family in Colorado are shattered when she is abandoned by her husband. Undaunted, she finds solace working at a stables and trains to compete in a high-stakes race - but her chances of victory are jeopardised when her horse goes blind. Drama, starring Julie Benz, Marsha Mason, Paul Le Mat and Gage Golightly

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A bomb goes off in a nightclub, killing the perpetrator in the process. The team examines the body, and discovers traces of radioactive material, sparking suspicion that another device has been planted somewhere in the city. It transpires the bomber was stabbed before the explosion - and Horatio's supposedly dead half-brother could have been involved. Last in the series

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: The team is called to a football stadium, where the skeletal remains of a gang member have been dug up. As the detectives start bagging evidence, a chance discovery puts Danny's job on the line. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise, Melina Kanakaredes and Carmine Giovinazzo

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Part one of two. Sloan tries to catch the Casanova Killer, and loses his impartial view of the case when the murderer calls him. Medical detective drama, starring Dick Van Dyke

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: A police officer is shot dead and the chief suspect's confession appears to bring an end to the matter, but his media-savvy lawyer presents a case accusing the force of a string of errors - as well as perceived racism. Guest starring Gregory Hines, in his final acting role before his death

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac examines the death of a Base jumper seemingly killed when he hit a flock of pigeons, and discovers the victim was in a witness protection programme. Meanwhile, Stella looks into the case of a wealthy man found dead in his car on the day of his daughter's 16th birthday party - and Lindsay is bitten by a cobra at the scene of the crime. Drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Lindsay receives a combat cross medal for bravery, and new recruit Jo Danville stumbles over a body in the crime lab on her first day in the role. The detectives discover the victim worked in one of the building's other offices, and Adam finds evidence suggesting death was premeditated. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Sela Ward

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A sniper begins a campaign of apparent random shootings in the city. The team knows that the killings are connected and identifies the criminal as a missing man who was subjected to abuse as a child, but Chief Carver refuses to make the information public, clashing with Mac in the process. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and John Larroquette

programme.title: Blood Work (2002)
programme.desc: A former FBI agent recuperating from a heart transplant is asked to track down his donor's murderer, and discovers that, far from being a random incident, the crime bears all the hallmarks of a serial killer who has evaded capture for years. Thriller, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Anjelica Huston, Jeff Daniels, Wanda De Jesus and Tina Lifford

programme.title: Steven Seagal
programme.desc: A routine traffic stop turns into a high-speed chase, the team plays cat and mouse with two alleged drug dealers, and Steven tests a rare Japanese sword

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: Chuck
programme.desc: The spy turns to ex-girlfriend Jill for help when his father is abducted by Fulcrum. Elsewhere, the Buy More crew tries to sabotage a corporate evaluation supervised by Emmett - but discovers he is wise to the ploy. Jordana Brewster guest stars, with Zachary Levi

programme.title: McBride
programme.desc: The cop-turned-lawyer takes on the case of a former soldier accused of stabbing his pregnant wife to death. Mystery, directed by and starring John Larroquette, with Marta DuBois and Matt Lutz

programme.title: Cedar Cove
programme.desc: Olivia comforts her best friend Grace when she is issued with divorce papers, and Justine makes a big decision when Warren reveals his plan to demolish the lighthouse and develop the land. Meanwhile, the owners of a local bed and breakfast decide to protest against the destruction and the case makes its way to Olivia's courtroom. Drama following the fortunes of a small-town judge, starring Andie MacDowell

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: Mac and Stella try to establish why two women have made conflicting claims to be the wife of a murder victim, and make a surprising discovery about the circumstances of their relationships. Meanwhile, Danny and Lindsay investigate the killing of a woman found near a dock, tangled up in seaweed and dressed as a mermaid. Crime drama, starring Gary Sinise and Melina Kanakaredes

programme.title: Diagnosis Murder
programme.desc: Part two of two. The prime suspect in the case suggests there is a copycat killer on the loose. Detective drama, starring Dick Van Dyke

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the fatal stabbing of a taxi driver whose body was left under his vehicle. The finger of suspicion points to a man who took a drunken ride in the cab on the same night - an ex-convict who is also a gifted writer - and his protege, whose fingerprints were found on a book and cigar left at the scene. Saul Rubinek, JK Simmons and Sonia Braga guest star alongside Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A bank at Quantico is robbed and a security guard killed, but the team soon discovers that stealing money may not have been the perpetrators' primary objective. Meanwhile, Gibbs is given the task of evaluating an inexperienced new agent assigned by Vance to help investigate the case. Crime drama, starring Mark Harmon and Rey Valentin

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: The team delves into Vance's troubled past in a desperate effort to trap a vengeful female assassin named Lee Wuan Kai. Although she is determined to strike back at him by targeting his family, it gradually transpires that there is another deeper motive for her crimes. Crime drama, guest starring Kelly Hu, with Mark Harmon, Rocky Carroll and Pauley Perrette

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Benson and Stabler are called in when a woman is admitted to hospital after being found in a distressed state on a bus, claiming to have been raped. She tells the detectives it is the fourth time she has been assaulted by the same man over the past 15 years, but runs off before they get to ask any more questions. Crime drama, guest starring Jennifer Love Hewitt

programme.title: Played
programme.desc: An ex-colleague of DS Ellis's called Marcus Jakes turns up on the radar after infiltrating a gang of racketeers, led by an uncompromising character whose interests centre on a vicious underground fight club. Rebecca still trusts Jakes, but Moreland believes he may have turned into `a dirty cop', so Jesse pulls on his gloves and gets into the ring, while Moreland plays a man looking to hire a contract killer in a bid to expose the truth. Canadian crime drama, guest starring Aaron Abrams (Rookie Blue), alongside Vincent Walsh and Chandra West

programme.title: Longmire
programme.desc: Walt investigates when a rodeo sponsor is assaulted in his own home and left in a coma. The only clue is the theft of a seemingly worthless painting

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A bomb detonates during a routine investigation into the murder of a security guard, leaving Flack barely conscious and with serious injuries. The team links the two incidents and races to stay one step ahead of the bomber, who contacts Mac to tell him he has been singled out as the next victim. Melina Kanakaredes, Carmine Giovinazzo, Vanessa Ferlito and Eddie Cahill star. Last in the series

programme.title: SuperCasino
programme.desc: Viewers get the chance to take part in live interactive gaming, with an entertaining mix of roulette-wheel spins and lively chat from the presenting team. Featuring a variety of prizes and promotions

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Buying goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Access
programme.desc: Showbiz news and gossip

programme.title: My Name Is Earl
programme.desc: Golf-obsessed Scott is next on Earl's list as he tries to make amends for the times when he and Randy fixed their friend's game so they could win free beer. However, the plan backfires - as usual. Johnny Galecki guest stars

programme.title: The Mentalist
programme.desc: Lisbon and Rigsby travel to Crane Creek, where they examine the murder of a film-maker who has been shot at close range. The local police identify a man who was accused of killing his wife two years previously as the main suspect, but when the agents close in, he takes the employees and customers at City Hall hostage, including Jane, who was settling a parking fine at the time. Crime drama, starring Robin Tunney and Simon Baker

programme.title: Attack on the Iron Coast (1968)
programme.desc: A Canadian major leads a commando attack against a German naval base on the French coast. However, his troubled past and conflict with a fellow officer place the operation in jeopardy, leaving them battling to put their personal problems aside and focus on survival. Second World War drama, starring Lloyd Bridges, Andrew Keir, Sue Lloyd and Mark Eden

programme.title: Colt .45 (1950)
programme.desc: A gun salesman pursues the outlaws who stole a consignment of his weapons, in the hope of proving he did not provide them willingly. The quest leads to him becoming a deputy lawman after he protects a stagecoach - but does not realise the sheriff is in league with the bandits he is hunting. Western, starring Randolph Scott and Ruth Roman

programme.title: Gunsmoke in Tucson (1958)
programme.desc: A boy who witnessed his father's murder grows up to be a hardened criminal, and his own brother is forced to bring him to justice. After his release from prison, he becomes a lawman and tries to stop a corrupt rancher seizing control of his neighbours' valuable land - but to do so, he needs the help of his old partners-in-crime. Western, starring Mark Stevens and Forrest Tucker

programme.title: The Sea Wolves (1980)
programme.desc: The German Navy uses three Goa-based vessels to attack Allied shipping, and their British counterparts cannot retaliate as they are moored in neutral waters. A group of retired officers living in India unofficially returns to duty to deal with the threat. Fact-based Second World War adventure, starring Gregory Peck, Roger Moore, David Niven, Trevor Howard, Barbara Kellerman and Patrick Macnee

programme.title: Crimson Tide (1995)
programme.desc: A veteran US submarine captain receives an incomplete message after a Russian base falls into rebel hands, and is convinced it is an order to fire his nuclear weapons. However, his first officer refuses to take such potentially devastating action without confirmed orders, leading to a deadly battle of wills. Thriller, starring Gene Hackman, Denzel Washington and Viggo Mortensen

programme.title: CSI
programme.desc: A man reports his wife's death, claiming she fell down the stairs in their home. However, Grissom and his team discover secrets including adultery, blackmail and a bizarre fetish within this supposedly conventional marriage that may ultimately have contributed to her demise. Drama, starring William Petersen

programme.title: Scrubs

programme.title: Scrubs
programme.desc: Kim goes into labour and JD struggles to decide whether to tell her what he really thinks of their relationship. programme.title: Event Horizon (1997)

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia

programme.title: Let's Make a Deal

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: 'Come on down!' Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972, though it originated with Bill Cullen on NBC (1956-63) and ABC (1963-65). However, it was the genial, ageless Barker who really sold viewers on the show, which spawned several syndicated offshoots and a string of prime-time specials. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes

programme.title: Wheel of Fortune
programme.desc: Creator-producer Merv Griffin's classic game-show version of `hangman' has kept on spinning for three decades. The money and prizes have gotten bigger over the years, but the basic format and difficulty of the mystery phrases have pretty much remained steady. Another series constant has been the nation's premier (and most fashionably dressed) letter-turner, Vanna White, who parlayed the gig into a bestselling 1987 autobiography. As for host Pat Sajak, he has won three Emmys for the series

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia

programme.title: Let's Make a Deal

programme.title: The Price Is Right
programme.desc: 'Come on down!' Contestants guess retail values for prizes on TV's longest-running game show. Bob Barker racked up over a dozen hosting Emmys since CBS first aired the daytime staple in 1972, though it originated with Bill Cullen on NBC (1956-63) and ABC (1963-65). However, it was the genial, ageless Barker who really sold viewers on the show, which spawned several syndicated offshoots and a string of prime-time specials. When Barker retired in 2007, Drew Carey stepped in to ably fill his shoes

programme.title: Grand Coulee Dam
programme.desc: The history of the Grand Coulee Dam on the Columbia River in Washington, which was one of the centerpiece projects of FDR's New Deal during the Great Depression. A controversial undertaking, it transformed the Pacific Northwest for good and bad, providing needed energy to the growing cities of Portland and Seattle even as it wiped away entire towns, dislocated Colville Indian Reservation tribes, and blocked the ability of salmon to reach their spawning grounds

programme.title: The Rise and Fall of Penn Station
programme.desc: The story of New York's Pennsylvania Station, which opened to the public in 1910. One of the greatest architectural and engineering achievements of its time, it covered nearly eight acres and required the construction of 16 miles of underground tunnels. It closed its doors some 50 years later, giving way to Madison Square Garden, a high-rise office building and sports complex

programme.title: Frontline
programme.desc: How marketers use social media to get teenagers to sell products to themselves—and collect valuable data in the process. Included: whether the division between marketing and authenticity still exists; the hidden alchemy that brands use to win over teens

programme.title: Newsline

programme.title: European Journal

programme.title: Nightly Business Report
programme.desc: A long-running weeknight business-news magazine that includes market reports, company information, CEO interviews and economic commentary. `NBR' began as a local broadcast in Miami in 1979, and when it went national in 1981, its roster of commentators included future Federal Reserve chairman Alan Greenspan

programme.title: The This Old House Hour

In the second half: a clawfoot tub with shower is installed; and a permanent fire-escape ladder is installed in a bedroom. Also: the best way to prune trees

programme.title: The Car Chasers

programme.title: The Car Chasers
programme.desc: Jeff, Meg and Perry travel to Las Vegas for an automotive trade show. Among their finds: a pristine 1965 Malibu; and two hot rods. programme.title: The Mentalist

programme.desc: Bobby tries to get Crowley to return his soul but when Crowley refuses Bobby takes matters into his own hands. Jensen Ackles directed the episode

programme.title: Castle

programme.desc: Dean believes his grandfather is harboring a secret and reluctantly goes on a hunt with him, which goes horribly awry
